Mother Venom Poison.name: Mother Venom Poison
Mother Venom Poison.description:
DC 38

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round).

Ooze Tendril.name: Ooze Tendril
Ooze Tendril.description: Mother Venom can command her minions and the oozes that cover her dungeon to attack foes. As long as she's conscious, she can make melee ooze tendril Strikes that originate from any slime-covered terrain in her dungeon, including the dungeon's walls and doors, or from a space occupied by one of her children of venom.

Spit.name: Spit
Spit.description: A creature hit by Mother Venom's spit attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface ([[/act escape dc=38]]).

Escort from the Premises.name: Escort from the Premises
Escort from the Premises.description:
Requirements The casino bouncer has Grabbed a Medium or smaller target and is wielding a nonlethal weapon in the other hand

Effect The casino bouncer makes a Strike against the grabbed target with the nonlethal weapon. If the Strike hits, it deals damage as usual and the casino bouncer moves the target 5 feet (this is forced movement) and Steps into the space the target had just occupied.

Intimidating Stare.name: Intimidating Stare
Intimidating Stare.description:
The casino bouncer attempts to [[/act demoralize]] a creature with a mere glance. The casino bouncer doesn't take a penalty to their Intimidation check if the target doesn't speak the same language.

If the bouncer rolls a critical success, the target can't reduce the value of its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition until [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} have passed.

Baatamidar.name: Baatamidar
Baatamidar.publicNotes: Baatamidars are drawn to destroy planar communities on the fringes where the Outer Planes touch the chaos of the Maelstrom. They resemble floating blobs of undulating, prismatic ooze with four quivering tentacles and dribbles of oily slime that always drip upwards.

Unrelativity Field.name: Unrelativity Field
Unrelativity Field.description:
1 mile. Creatures who start their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:48|traits:incapacitation] save or become unable to understand any communication (including telepathy), distinguish social rank or authority, or differentiate the relative value of objects or services. This persists for as long as the creature is in the aura.

Creatures who succeed at the save are temporarily immune for 1 hour (24 hours on a critical success). Proteans are immune to the unrelativity field.

The baatamidar can suppress this aura or activate it again as a free action.

Mind-Numbing Grasp.name: Mind-Numbing Grasp
Mind-Numbing Grasp.description:
The baatamidar's tentacles leech away thought. A creature that starts its turn grabbed by the baatamidar must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41|traits:arcane,enchantment,incapacitation,mental] save.

Critical Success Unaffected.

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for an unlimited duration.

Writhing Arms.name: Writhing Arms
Writhing Arms.description:
The baatamidar makes up to four tentacle Strikes, each against a different target. Each attack counts separately for the baatamidar's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until the baatamidar has made all the attacks.

If the baatamidar subsequently uses the Improved Grab action, it can Grab any number of creatures it hit with Writhing Arms.

Tear Flesh.name: Tear Flesh
Tear Flesh.description:
Trigger A creature grabbed by the barnacle ghoul critically fails a skill check to Escape

Effect The barnacle ghoul makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The barnacle ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The barnacle ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[5d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Fill Lungs.name: Fill Lungs
Fill Lungs.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:26]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} (1 round)

Stage 4 drowning and cannot reduce below stage 4 until the water is purged; purging the water requires a successful @Check[medicine|dc:26|name:Purge Water|traits:manipulate,action:administer-first-aid] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} (which stops the creature from drowning and returns the creature to stage 3; stage 2 on a critical success) or a magical effect that removes curses or the sickened condition (which stops the creature from drowning and ends the curse).

If the creature dies from drowning, it rises as a barnacle ghoul the next midnight.

Nimble Swim.name: Nimble Swim
Nimble Swim.description: The barnacle ghoul Swims up to 20 feet. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description:
Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}.

It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Grunka.name: Grunka
Grunka.publicNotes:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

Goblin Scuttle.name: Goblin Scuttle
Goblin Scuttle.description:
Trigger A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to Grunka.

Effect Grunka @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}.

Waves of Sorrow.name: Waves of Sorrow
Waves of Sorrow.description: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it is overwhelmed by the sorrow that suffuses the obrousian's being. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description: The obrousian can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This increases their Speed to 25 feet. It doesn't change their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

Drowning Grasp.name: Drowning Grasp
Drowning Grasp.description: When a creature is grabbed by the obrousian, its lungs magically fill with water. A creature that can't breathe water is suffocating while it is grabbed.

Arrogant Taunts.name: Arrogant Taunts
Arrogant Taunts.description:
The eberark utters crude insults and growls threateningly. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:27] save.

The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} and paralyzed for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Incendiary Spit.name: Incendiary Spit
Incendiary Spit.description:
A creature hit by the eberark's spit becomes coated in a slippery, flammable oil.

The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they are coated in incendiary spit.

Creatures affected by incendiary spit that take fire damage catch fire, taking @Damage[3d6[persistent,fire]] damage. Once this persistent fire damage ends, the spit has burned away.

Trail of Flame.name: Trail of Flame
Trail of Flame.description:
The eberark Strides twice, leaving a trail of magical fire behind it as it moves. Squares the eberark moves through catch fire, creating a 5-foot-tall wall of flame that burns for 1 round. The wall of flame conceals creatures and objects on the other side of it.

Any creature that enters or starts its turn in the wall of flame takes @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save).

equipment-Light Mace.name: Light Mace
equipment-Light Mace.description: A light mace has a short wooden or metal shaft ending with a dense metal head. Used much like a club, it delivers heavy bludgeoning blows, but with extra power derived from the head's metal ridges or spikes.

equipment-Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
equipment-Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment-Alchemist's Tools.name: Alchemist's Tools
equipment-Alchemist's Tools.description: This mobile collection of vials and chemicals can be used for simple alchemical tasks.

equipment-Formula Book (Blank).name: Formula Book (Blank)
equipment-Formula Book (Blank).description: A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.

Infused Items.name: Infused Items
Infused Items.description: The chemist carries the following infused items, which last 24 hours or until the next time the amateur chemist makes their daily preparations: infused moderate bottled lightning (4), infused moderate frost vials (2), infused reagents (6), infused moderate silvertongue mutagens (2).

Alchemical Formulas (5th).name: Alchemical Formulas (5th)
Alchemical Formulas (5th).description: lesser antidote, moderate bottled lightning, moderate frost vial, graveroot, hunting spider venom, moderate quicksilver mutagen, moderate silvertongue mutagen

Calculated Splash.name: Calculated Splash
Calculated Splash.description: The chemist's bombs that have the splash trait deal 4 splash damage.

Quick Alchemy.name: Quick Alchemy
Quick Alchemy.description:
Cost 1 batch of infused reagents

Effect The chemist creates a single alchemical item from their formula book (see Alchemical Formulas). This item has the infused trait, but it remains potent only until the start of their next turn.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: The chemist Interacts to draw a bomb then Strikes with it.

Plunger Chute.name: Plunger Chute
Plunger Chute.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:23|name:Jam the Trapdoor Shut|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to jam the trapdoor shut or activate a hidden bypass switch by twisting a fitting on the gas lamp
Plunger Chute.hazarddescription: A trapdoor in the floor conceals a hidden chute, and a moving section of wall shoves victims into it.

Pitfall and Plunger.name: Pitfall and Plunger
Pitfall and Plunger.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the trapdoor

Effect Anyone within 10 feet of the room's northern wall falls 40 feet down the shaft to area E33, taking @Damage[20[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage and landing @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in the ochre jelly's pit.

The victims can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} to avoid falling.

The DC to Grab an Edge is 20; the DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} the walls is 22.

Vein Walker.name: Vein Walker
Vein Walker.description:
The excorion moves about by way of hundreds of pulsating blood vessels, which stretch from its body in dozens of tight, ropy bundles and anchor it to the ground.

An excorion can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Tripped}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoved}, or otherwise forcibly moved except by magic, and the excorion ignores difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain).

Blinding Bile.name: Blinding Bile
Blinding Bile.description:
The excorion paragon projects a mist of burning blood in a @Template[cone|distance:10].

Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d8[acid], 5d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]{10d8 acid damage and 5d8 bludgeoning damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect] save).

On a failed save, an affected creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round (or 2 rounds on a critical failure).

The excorion can't use Blinding Bile again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Blinding Bile]]{1d4 rounds}.

Vital Transfusion.name: Vital Transfusion
Vital Transfusion.description:
Requirements The excorion has at least 200 Hit Points

Effect The excorion sacrifices itself and transfers its bloody, vital energy to a willing living creature within 30 feet. The excorion is immediately destroyed, and the targeted living creature heals a number of HP equal to half the excorion's remaining HP at the time that it used this ability.

The living creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} during its next turn as its body adjusts to the newly transfused blood and vital energy.

Vomit Blood.name: Vomit Blood
Vomit Blood.description:
The excorion spews necrotic blood all over a foe it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

The grabbed creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Divert Strike.name: Divert Strike
Divert Strike.description:
Trigger A shatterling takes non-bludgeoning damage and there's an unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide within 100 feet of the shatterling

Effect The nearest mirror to the shatterling at least 1 foot wide breaks, and the damage to the shatterling is reduced to 0.

Extra Reaction.name: Extra Reaction
Extra Reaction.description: A shatterling gains an additional reaction each turn, but can use this extra reaction only for Divert Strike.

Mirror Senses.name: Mirror Senses
Mirror Senses.description: A shatterling can see and hear through any unbroken mirror within 100 feet.

Blood-Fueled Titter.name: Blood-Fueled Titter
Blood-Fueled Titter.description: If the shatterling attempts an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize]] a target within 30 feet of a creature with persistent bleed damage, the shatterling has +4 circumstance bonus to the Intimidation check. In addition, the shatterling takes no penalty to the check for not speaking a language the target can hear, and the target isn't temporarily immune to the shatterling's attempts to Demoralize it unless the shatterling critically fails its Intimidation check.

Mirror Jump.name: Mirror Jump
Mirror Jump.description: During this Stride, the shatterling can move into any unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide and out of another unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide within 100 feet of the first mirror, treating the mirrors as connected. The shatterling can move through any number of pairs of foot-wide mirrors during its mirror jump, requiring each pair to be within 100 feet of each other while doing so.

Vanish in Reflections.name: Vanish in Reflections
Vanish in Reflections.description: The shatterling doesn't appear in reflective surfaces if it doesn't want to. When it's within 100 feet of an unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide, a shatterling can Hide and Sneak even without cover or without being concealed.

Wipe Away Cracks.name: Wipe Away Cracks
Wipe Away Cracks.description: The shatterling touches a broken mirror, instantly repairing it.

Pulping Golem.name: Pulping Golem
Pulping Golem.publicNotes: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don't rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren't destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by acid (@Damage[(6d10+4)[untyped]], @Damage[(2d8+4)[untyped]] from areas and persistent damage); healed by fire (area @Damage[(2d8+4)[healing]] HP); slowed by electricity

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison.name: Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison
Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison.description: Casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} on the golem deactivates its Breath Weapon for 1 minute.

Vulnerable to Rust.name: Vulnerable to Rust
Vulnerable to Rust.description: Magical rusting effects, like a rust monster's antennae, affect the iron golem normally.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
The pulping golem spills its cauldron stomach to the floor, dealing @Damage[9d12[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures within 10 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Extend Legs.name: Extend Legs
Extend Legs.description: The pulping golem extends its legs up to a height of 40 feet, raising its body high into the air. While its legs are extended, its movement speed is halved, and it takes a -2 penalty to its Fortitude save DC against @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} attempts.

Inexorable March.name: Inexorable March
Inexorable March.description: The iron golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it is damaged as if hit by the golem's fist.

Iron Golem Poison.name: Iron Golem Poison
Iron Golem Poison.description:
Any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} value from this poison is reduced by 1 every hour.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:35]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[(2d6+4)[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[(4d6+4)[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[(8d6+4)[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 round)

Planar Coven.name: Planar Coven
Planar Coven.description: As long as at least one other member of Myrna's coven is on the demiplane of Stormholt, the coven members add chain lightning, lightning bolt, plane shift, and punishing winds to their spells, each of which can be cast at up to 8th level.

Sea Hag's Bargain.name: Sea Hag's Bargain
Sea Hag's Bargain.description: The sea hag can make a bargain with a willing creature, who must be of sound mind. The creature gives away a special or cherished quality-such as its courage, its beauty, or its voice-in exchange for a boon or a promise from the sea hag. As long as the sea hag keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore the lost quality is to defeat the sea hag or make another bargain for its return.

Dread Gaze.name: Dread Gaze
Dread Gaze.description:
The hag gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with intense distress and a gnawing sense of impending doom, with a result depending on its @Check[will|dc:37] save. The target does not need to be able to see the sea hag.

Critical Success No effect.

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure Frightened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round. If the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}, it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

Critical Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and slowed 1 for 1 minute. If the target was dying, it remains unconscious for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

Pull Under.name: Pull Under
Pull Under.description:
Requirements A creature within 60 feet of Graem or Grinlowe is in contact with the waters of Stormholt

Effect The hag casts maze (DC 37) on the creature, magically pulling the creature beneath the water (regardless of its actual depth) into an extradimensional underwater maze of shipwrecks. Between the two of them, Graem and Grinlowe can have only one creature trapped in the maze, but either hag can use the Sustain a Spell action to sustain the effect.

Hegessik.name: Hegessik
Hegessik.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. divine magic

Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description:
A hegessik can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the hegessik the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The hegessik's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.

+1 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Divine Magi.name: +1 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Divine Magic

Maddening Whispers.name: Maddening Whispers
Maddening Whispers.description:
30 feet. A susurrus of distracting whispers and dilations in reality surround a hegessik.

When a non-protean ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Protean Anatomy 20.name: Protean Anatomy 20
Protean Anatomy 20.description:
A hegessik's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the hegessik takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The hegessik is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the hegessik automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The hegessik takes the appearance of any Large or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Leaching Glare.name: Leaching Glare
Leaching Glare.description:
The hegessik briefly opens its third eye.

Non-protean creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:38] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure).

Telekinetic Reach.name: Telekinetic Reach
Telekinetic Reach.description:
The hegessik manifests psychic versions of its natural attacks and makes a Strike with each of its jaws, claw, and tail, in any order. These Strikes have a reach of 60 feet.

These attacks count toward the hegessik's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.

Warpwave Strike.name: Warpwave Strike
Warpwave Strike.description: Any creature struck and damaged by a hegessik's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or be subject to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave}

Scurry.name: Scurry
Scurry.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement adjacent to Kolo

Effect Kolo Steps.

Upward Stab.name: Upward Stab
Upward Stab.description: Kolo's melee Strikes deal an extra 1d6 precision damage to Medium or larger creatures.

Boiling Fountains.name: Boiling Fountains
Boiling Fountains.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:21|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to disable each pressure plate, @Check[thievery|dc:16|name:Jam Fountain|traits:action:disable-a-device] to jam each fountain, or @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Deflect Fountain's Spray|traits:action:disable-a-device] to deflect a fountain's spray
Boiling Fountains.hazarddescription: Four pressure plates beneath the floorboards activate dragon-headed fountains on either side of the room, which spray boiling water across the area between them.
Boiling Fountains.reset: Once a pressure plate has been activated, it must be reset manually.

Scalding Spray.name: Scalding Spray
Scalding Spray.description:
Trigger Weight is placed on one of the squares marked with "T" on the map, triggering a pressure plate

Effect The fountains spray boiling water across their own squares and the 10-foot-by-20-foot area between them (marked with dotted lines), dealing @Damage[(4d6+4)[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to any creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Penqual.name: Penqual
Penqual.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Easy to Call.name: Easy to Call
Easy to Call.description: The sahkil is considered 2 levels lower for the purposes of being summoned by rituals (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle}), but is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Crowded Mob.name: Crowded Mob
Crowded Mob.description: The penqual is a swarm of Medium figures that can squeeze supernaturally close to other creatures. Though its component creatures are larger than those of a typical swarm, a penqual can nevertheless share the spaces of other creatures.

Crush of Hundreds.name: Crush of Hundreds
Crush of Hundreds.description:
A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} by the sahkil's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O6VQC1Bs4aSYDa6R]{Mask of Terror} feels the press of a suffocating crowd.

The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and takes a –10-foot penalty to all Speeds for as long as it is frightened.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.R8clbf7gtIlU3fIj]{Effect: Crush of Hundreds}

Frantic Grasp.name: Frantic Grasp
Frantic Grasp.description: Each enemy in the penqual's space takes @Damage[4d12[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic] save).

Mob Rush.name: Mob Rush
Mob Rush.description: The penqual Strides twice, ignoring difficult terrain, and then uses Frantic Grasp. If it moves at least 20 feet away from its starting position, the DC of Frantic Grasp increases by 2.

Skip Between.name: Skip Between
Skip Between.description: The sahkil can move itself between the Ethereal Plane and the Material Plane, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt}, except that this ability has an unlimited duration and can be Dismissed

equipment-Dagger.name: Dagger
equipment-Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment-+2 Greater Striking War Razor.name: +2 Greater Striking War Razor
equipment-+2 Greater Striking War Razor.description: A war razor is an exaggerated version of the barbers' tool. It is a brittle but extremely sharp weapon that is very easy to slip into a pocket or sleeve.

equipment-+2 Resilient Studded Leather A.name: +2 Resilient Studded Leather Armor
equipment-+2 Resilient Studded Leather A.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

Bloody Mayhem.name: Bloody Mayhem
Bloody Mayhem.description: Twisted Jack Strides three times. Once per Stride, he can attempt a war razor Strike against a creature in his reach at any point during the Stride; he must make each Strike against a different creature, but he doesn't apply his multiple attack penalty until after making all his Strikes. If any of the Strikes are a critical failure, Bloody Mayhem immediately ends.

Close Cutter.name: Close Cutter
Close Cutter.description: Whenever Twisted Jack deals slashing damage, the target takes an additional 2d10 persistent bleed damage.

Fan of Daggers.name: Fan of Daggers
Fan of Daggers.description: Twisted Jack makes three ranged dagger Strikes, each against a separate target; he ignores the multiple attack penalty until after making all three Strikes. On a critical hit, the target takes @Damage[2d10[bleed]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Knife Thrower.name: Knife Thrower
Knife Thrower.description: Twisted Jack's ranged dagger Strikes have a range increment of 20 feet instead of 10 feet.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Twisted Jack deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Haphazard Hack.name: Haphazard Hack
Haphazard Hack.description:
Requirements Rekarek is adjacent to two or more enemies

Effect Rekarek makes three melee weapon Strikes, two of which must be against different enemies.

These attacks count toward her multiple attack penalty, but only after all three Strikes have been made.

After taking this activity, Rekarek is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of her next turn.

equipment-Dagger.name: Dagger
equipment-Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment-+2 Greater Striking War Razor.name: +2 Greater Striking War Razor
equipment-+2 Greater Striking War Razor.description: A war razor is an exaggerated version of the barbers' tool. It is a brittle but extremely sharp weapon that is very easy to slip into a pocket or sleeve.

equipment-+2 Resilient Studded Leather A.name: +2 Resilient Studded Leather Armor
equipment-+2 Resilient Studded Leather A.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

equipment-Necklace of Fireballs VI.name: Necklace of Fireballs VI
equipment-Necklace of Fireballs VI.description:
This string of beads appears to be a hemp string with lustrous red beads of various sizes hanging from it. When activated, it briefly appears in its true form: a golden chain with golden spheres attached by fine threads.

This necklace has one @Damage[16d6[fire]] damage, three @Damage[14d6[fire]] damage and four @Damage[12d6[fire]] damage beads with a Reflex save DC of 36. When all the beads are gone, the necklace becomes a non-magical hemp string.

Activate A Interact

Effect You detach a sphere from the necklace, causing it to glow with orange light. After you activate a sphere, if you or anyone else hurls it (an Interact action with the ranged trait), it detonates as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} where it lands. Your toss can place the center of the fireball anywhere within 70 feet, though at the GM's discretion you might need to make an attack roll if the throw is unusually challenging. If no one hurls the sphere by the start of your next turn, it turns into a non-magical red bead.

Bloody Mayhem.name: Bloody Mayhem
Bloody Mayhem.description: Sad Liza Strides three times. Once per Stride, she can attempt a war razor Strike against a creature in her reach at any point during the Stride; she must make each Strike against a different creature, but she doesn't apply her multiple attack penalty until after making all her Strikes. If any of the Strikes are a critical failure, Bloody Mayhem immediately ends.

Close Cutter.name: Close Cutter
Close Cutter.description: Whenever Sad Liza deals slashing damage, the target takes an additional 2d10 persistent bleed damage.

Fan of Daggers.name: Fan of Daggers
Fan of Daggers.description: Sad Liza makes three ranged dagger Strikes, each against a separate target; she ignores the multiple attack penalty until after making all three Strikes. On a critical hit, the target takes @Damage[2d10[bleed]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Knife Thrower.name: Knife Thrower
Knife Thrower.description: Sad Liza's ranged dagger Strikes have a range increment of 20 feet instead of 10 feet.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Sad Liza deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Rigged Cubby.name: Rigged Cubby
Rigged Cubby.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Cut String|traits:action:disable-a-device] to cut the string without setting off the trap
Rigged Cubby.hazarddescription: A hidden string connected to precariously stacked bricks causes the cubby to collapse in on itself when the string is pulled.

Collapse.name: Collapse
Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature touches the sickle in the cubby

Effect The heavy bricks above the cubby collapse, leaving the sickle unscathed but dealing @Damage[(4d6+10)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save) to the triggering creature.

Bullyrag Beatdown.name: Bullyrag Beatdown
Bullyrag Beatdown.description: Whenever the gang tough makes a successful melee Strike against a frightened creature, the Strike deals an extra weapon die of damage.

Frightening Critical.name: Frightening Critical
Frightening Critical.description: When the gang tough's Strike with a bludgeoning weapon is a critical hit and deals damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Scraping Clamor.name: Scraping Clamor
Scraping Clamor.description:
The Washboard Dog scrapes their weapon up and down their washboard shield, making such a clatter that it's hard to hear anything over the din. Until the beginning of the Washboard Dog tough's next turn, all creatures within 30 feet gain a +1 circumstance bonus to any saves to resist auditory spells or abilities.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wcNGbhwn3AuamtsX]{Effect: Scraping Clamor}

Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: A bone skipper swarm identifies bones and creatures with a skeletal system in the listed range.

Marrow Rot.name: Marrow Rot
Marrow Rot.description:
Marrow rot affects only creatures with a skeletal system

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic]) save plus exposure to marrow rot.

Poisoned Dart Statue.name: Poisoned Dart Statue
Poisoned Dart Statue.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:34|name:Disable Trap|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on the control panel deactivates the trap.
Poisoned Dart Statue.hazarddescription: Countless poison darts fire from holes in the statues and walls of this hall.
Poisoned Dart Statue.routine: (1 action) The trap launches one dart against every creature in the hall as 1 action. Because it launches darts continuously, the trap can also use the Continuous Barrage free action (see below) to launch darts at each creature during that creature's turn. The trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Poisoned Dart Statue.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.
Poisoned Dart Statue.stealthdetails: (expert) or @Check[perception|dc:39|traits:action:seek] (master) to notice the control panel. Anyone specifically searching the name plate of Abresha Tallow-Hands locates the control panel automatically.

Dart Volley.name: Dart Volley
Dart Volley.description:
Trigger A creature makes noise in the hall, which can be avoided with a successful @Check[stealth|dc:28|name:Avoid Notice|traits:action:sneak,move,secret] check

Effect The trap makes a poisoned dart Strike against the triggering creature, then rolls initiative.

Continuous Barrage.name: Continuous Barrage
Continuous Barrage.description:
Trigger A creature within the hallway finishes an action while the trap is active

Effect The trap makes a poisoned dart Strike against the triggering creature.

Terinav Root Poison.name: Terinav Root Poison
Terinav Root Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:28]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 4d6 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)

Stage 2 5d6 poison damage, clumsy 2, and –5-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 round)

Stage 3 7d6 poison damage, clumsy 2, and –10-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 round)

Cheek Pouches.name: Cheek Pouches
Cheek Pouches.description: A ratfolk has stretchy cheek pouches that can store up to 1 cubic foot of objects. The ratfolk can remove or store an item using the Interact action. As long as the ratfolk has at least one object in its cheek pouches, its speech is noticeably difficult to understand.

Katar Specialist.name: Katar Specialist
Katar Specialist.description: Kekker has trained extensively with the katar blade. Any katar he wields gains the finesse trait.

Quick Stow.name: Quick Stow
Quick Stow.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect Kekker stores one held item of light or negligible Bulk in his cheek pouches.

Swarming.name: Swarming
Swarming.description:
A ratfolk can end its movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability.

Only two such creatures can share the same space.

Prickly Defense.name: Prickly Defense
Prickly Defense.description:
The avarek withdraws beneath its spines, presenting a defensive, spiky exterior. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to spine Strikes and AC. Any adjacent creature that attempts a melee attack against the avarek takes 1d6 piercing damage per attack, regardless of whether the attack hits.

Prickly Defense lasts until the avarek uses a move action or makes a Strike with any weapon other than its spines.

Rolling Assault.name: Rolling Assault
Rolling Assault.description:
The avarek curls into a ball and rolls rapidly, impaling enemies with its spines. The avarek Strides twice and makes up to two spine Strikes at any point during its movement, each against a different target within reach.

These attacks count toward the avarek's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the avarek makes all the attacks.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The avarek's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Eyeball Tank.name: Eyeball Tank
Eyeball Tank.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:38|name:Acidify Slime|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) or @Check[crafting|dc:34|name:Acidify Slime] (expert) to acidify the slime inside the tank, destroying the eyeballs
Eyeball Tank.hazarddescription: A vat of thick glass stands 10 feet high and is filled with green slime and fist-sized eyeballs.
Eyeball Tank.routine: (3 actions) Each round, the vat uses all three of its actions to shoot random eye rays at any living creatures (except Ixusoth) in range.

Eye-Opener.name: Eye-Opener
Eye-Opener.description:
Trigger Three or more living creatures remain within 20 feet of the trap for 1 round

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

Spill Eyeballs.name: Spill Eyeballs
Spill Eyeballs.description:
Trigger The tank reaches its Broken Threshold

Effect The glass shatters, spilling eyeballs onto the floor in a @Template[emanation|distance:15]{15-foot radius} and casting grease (DC 33) on the affected area. The eyeball tank is permanently destroyed and can't be reset.Reset The trap can be reset by adding 100 new eyeballs to the tank and allowing them to grow in the slime for 1 week.

Cast Down.name: Cast Down
Cast Down.description: When the acolyte casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} to damage one creature, that creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} if it takes any damage from the spell. If the creature critically fails its save against the spell, it also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 minute.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The acolyte deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Living Paints.name: Living Paints
Living Paints.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:41|name:Crafting Disable] (master) to mix the paints into bland, useless colors, @Check[thievery|dc:41|name:Thievery Disable] (legendary) to dismantle the animated brushes, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 41) to counteract the magic within the paint.
Living Paints.hazarddescription: A mass of brushes use magical paint to convert creatures into art.

Capture Subject.name: Capture Subject
Capture Subject.description:
Trigger A creature steps into the same space as the paints

Effect The brushes animate and attempt to paint all creatures within 30 feet. The creatures must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:41] save to avoid the brushes and splashes from paint cans or be converted into living artwork for 1 hour.

A creature that becomes living artwork is immediately bound to the nearest flat surface of its size or larger within 30 feet. The creature can move only along flat surfaces such as floors and walls. This allows it to end its movement wrapped around corners when on a continuous surface.

While bound to a surface, the creature can attack from its space as normal, including against other creatures bound to the same surface.

If the surface it's on is destroyed (such as a portrait hit by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} spell or a wall being demolished), the creature takes [[/r {10d6}]]{10d6 damage} and is shunted to the nearest flat surface. If there is no flat surface within 5 feet, the creature is destroyed.

Clockwork Arms.name: Clockwork Arms
Clockwork Arms.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43|name:Deactivate One Arm|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to jam and deactivate one of the arms or @Check[athletics|dc:46|name:Tear Arm Off Machine] (legendary) to tear an arm off the machine.
Clockwork Arms.hazarddescription: Four claw-tipped clockwork arms suspended from the ceiling pick up and deposit creatures into a nearby hatch.
Clockwork Arms.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action per arm destroyed or disabled. On its turn, the trap makes claw Strikes against creatures other than the Rumormonger or the Inkmaster. If an arm already has a creature grabbed, the trap spends 2 actions to use its Open Hatch ability.

Arm Activation.name: Arm Activation
Arm Activation.description:
Trigger The Rumormonger or the Inkmaster enters the room

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

Open Hatch.name: Open Hatch
Open Hatch.description: The metal hatch opens and the arms deposit a grabbed Medium or smaller creature into the hole. The creature becomes caught in the gears (see Caught in Gears) for 1 round before emerging in area K5. Reset Rewinding the gears for [[/gmr 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes} resets the trap.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
When Frefferth is destroyed, his body and items dissipate into shadowy nothingness and the knight re-forms after [[/gmr 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days} within the sarcophagus in area D12, fully healed.

Frefferth can be trapped only by returning the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6MIBHKMJmD8uQVam]{Chain of the Stilled Spirit} to the sarcophagus (see areas D12 and D34), in which case Frefferth's body dissipates, leaving his items in the spot where he was last slain.

Head Hunter.name: Head Hunter
Head Hunter.description:
Any slashing weapon a dullahan wields becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.hg3IogR8ue2IWwgS]{Keen}, and any hatchet it wields becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qlunQzfnzPQpMG6U]{Returning}.

If the dullahan kills a creature with a critical hit using a slashing weapon, the target is decapitated as though the dullahan had used Reap on the target.

These effects remain only while the dullahan holds the weapon.

Impaler.name: Impaler
Impaler.description:
Whenever Frefferth damages a creature with a critical hit using a ranged piercing weapon, the weapon remains impaled in the victim's body.

The victim becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} as long as they are impaled; the impaling weapon can be removed by the affected creature or an adjacent ally as a 2-action activity that has the manipulate trait.

Reap.name: Reap
Reap.description:
Frefferth removes the head of a dead creature within reach.

Each creature within the area of Frefferth's frightful presence must attempt a new save, even if they are temporarily immune.

Summon Steed.name: Summon Steed
Summon Steed.description:
Frefferth summons a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.qRUqoezeEnQ2KdyT]{Nightmare}.

This steed remains until it is slain, Frefferth @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AjLSHZSWQ90exdLo]{Dismisses} it, or Frefferth summons another steed.

equipment-+2 Greater Striking Longsword.name: +2 Greater Striking Longsword
equipment-+2 Greater Striking Longsword.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

equipment-+2 Resilient Full Plate.name: +2 Resilient Full Plate
equipment-+2 Resilient Full Plate.description: Plate mail consists of interlocking plates that encase nearly the entire body in a carapace of steel. It is costly and heavy, and the wearer often requires help to don it correctly, but it provides some of the best defense armor can supply. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor (see below) and a pair of gauntlets.

equipment-Ring of Sustenance.name: Ring of Sustenance
equipment-Ring of Sustenance.description: This polished wooden ring constantly refreshes your body and mind. You don't need to eat or drink while wearing it, and you need only 2 hours of sleep per day to gain the benefits of 8 hours of sleep. A ring of sustenance doesn't function until it's been worn and invested continuously for a week. Removing it resets this interval.

equipment-Whisper Briolette.name: Whisper Briolette
equipment-Whisper Briolette.description:
Activate 2 Envision

Requirements You are an expert in Stealth

This teardrop-shaped gemstone has triangular facets and looks suitable for fancy attire, although close inspection shows that it's hollow. When it's activated, you can instantly impart up to 1 minute of speech (roughly 150 words) telepathically to any creatures you choose within 100 feet. You can impart this instantaneous telepathic message to creatures that you perceive and creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to you, but you can't do so to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} creatures. Once used, the whisper briolette becomes unusable and subtly vanishes within the next few minutes, rather than crumbling to dust.

Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Tactical Aura.name: Tactical Aura
Tactical Aura.description: 60 feet. Allies of lower level than Wynsal in the aura gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{Attack of Opportunity} reaction. Allies who already have the Attack of Opportunity reaction can use it when a creature within their reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to normal triggers, and they disrupt a triggering concentrate action on a critical hit.

Demanding Orders.name: Demanding Orders
Demanding Orders.description: Wynsal commands his allies to take action. Allies within 120 feet who hear and understand his order are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} for 1 round and can use this extra action to Stride, Strike, or Step.

Determination.name: Determination
Determination.description: Wynsal either ends a nonpermanent condition affecting him or counteracts a nonpermanent spell affecting him (counteract rank 17th, counteract check [[/r 1d20+30 #Counteract]]{+30}). This doesn't remove Hit Point damage or prevent the spell or effect from affecting others. It can't remove an ongoing affliction or conditions from a situation outside his control (such as being grappled or flanked).

Formation Attack.name: Formation Attack
Formation Attack.description: Wynsal deals 3d8 extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of his allies.

Hampering Strike.name: Hampering Strike
Hampering Strike.description: A foe that takes damage from Wynsal's melee Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round. If it's already slowed, the value of the slowed condition increases by 1.

Bullyrag Beatdown.name: Bullyrag Beatdown
Bullyrag Beatdown.description: Whenever the gang tough makes a successful melee Strike against a frightened creature, the Strike deals an extra weapon die of damage.

Frightening Critical.name: Frightening Critical
Frightening Critical.description: When the gang tough's Strike with a bludgeoning weapon is a critical hit and deals damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Combustible.name: Combustible
Combustible.description: The first time each round that a pickled punk takes fire damage, its fumes combust, dealing @Damage[5[fire]] damage to all other creatures within the area of its Suffocating Fumes aura.

Suffocating Fumes.name: Suffocating Fumes
Suffocating Fumes.description:
5 feet. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save, or @Check[fortitude|dc:17] if the pickled punk is attached to the creature.

On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.

Attach.name: Attach
Attach.description:
When a pickled punk hits a target larger than itself, it uses bizarre excretions to adhere to that creature. This is similar to Grabbing the creature, but the pickled punk is not off-guard, and it moves with that creature rather than holding it in place.

Each turn while attached, the pickled punk automatically deals the damage from its jaws Strike to the creature to which it's attached. It also wriggles about, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC as long as it's not also grabbed or restrained.

Emotion Sense 120 feet.name: Emotion Sense 120 feet
Emotion Sense 120 feet.description: A teraphant can sense the emotions of creatures within 120 feet as an imprecise sense. Emotion sense is a precise sense against creatures under an emotion effect. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} can't be noticed via emotion sense.

Empathetic Response.name: Empathetic Response
Empathetic Response.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet of the teraphant is targeted by a spell or ability with the emotion trait

Effect The teraphant also benefits from the spell or effect, as though it were an additional target for 1 minute or until the triggering spell or ability ends.

Impale.name: Impale
Impale.description:
Requirement The teraphant has a creature grabbed

Effect The teraphant slams the creature onto one of its horns. The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save or suffer @Damage[(3d6+9)[piercing]] damage and @Damage[1d6[bleed]] (@Damage[(6d6+18)[piercing]] damage on a critical failure).

Psychokinetic Trumpet.name: Psychokinetic Trumpet
Psychokinetic Trumpet.description:
The teraphant lets out a loud trumpet that deals @Damage[8d8[mental]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:27|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:forced-movement] save) in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. A creature that fails its save is also pushed 15 feet (30 feet on a critical failure).

If a pushed creatures strikes a solid barrier, it takes @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]] damage and stops.

The teraphant can't use Psychokinetic Trumpet again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Psychokinetic Trumpet]]{1d4 rounds}.

Grabbing Trunk.name: Grabbing Trunk
Grabbing Trunk.description: A Medium or smaller creature hit by the teraphant's trunk is grabbed. If the teraphant moves, it can bring the grabbed creature along with it.

Agent of the Gray Queen.name: Agent of the Gray Queen
Agent of the Gray Queen.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Displacement.name: Displacement
Displacement.description:
An astradaemon bends light, appearing shifted from its true position, though still in the same space.

Creatures targeting the astradaemon must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:11] check, as if the astradaemon were hidden, even though it remains observed.

Effects such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.y2XeMe1F18lIyo59]{Blind-Fight} feat and halfling's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.ancestryfeatures.Item.y1EmCv2cEb5hXBwx]{Keen Eyes} that apply on the flat check against hidden creatures also apply against a displaced astradaemon.

Soul Siphon.name: Soul Siphon
Soul Siphon.description:
30 feet. An astradaemon draws power from the souls of the recently slain. If a Small or larger living creature dies within its aura, the astradaemon gains 5 temporary Hit Points and a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 round, unless the creature was slain by an astradaemon's Devour Soul ability.

Incorporeal undead and living spirits traveling outside the body take @Damage[1d8[force]] damage each round within the daemon's aura from the spiritual pressure as the astradaemon pulls in fragments of their soul.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.SjrM6XVTLySToS12]{Effect: Soul Siphon}

Essence Drain.name: Essence Drain
Essence Drain.description:
When an astradaemon hits with its claw, jaws, or tail, it drains the target's spiritual and vital essences.

The target takes @Damage[2d10[void]] damage and the astradaemon regains an equal number of Hit Points. The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:37|traits:damaging-effect] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

If the target was already drained or doomed, it instead increases both conditions' value by 1, to a maximum of 4.

Mortal Shell.name: Mortal Shell
Mortal Shell.description:
Requirements The astradaemon has killed a Large or smaller creature with Overtake Soul within the past 24 hours and that creature is within the daemon's reach

Effect The astradaemon takes over and wears the body of their victim. This automatically creates a disguise to allow the astradaemon to Impersonate the target creature. The body has a number of Hit Points equal to 3 times the level of the creature. Any damage targeting the astradaemon damages the body first. Once the body is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it's destroyed and forces the astradaemon out, back to the daemon's normal form. If the astradaemon takes any spirit damage while wearing the body, the damage is dealt to the astradaemon directly and it must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check or be forced out of the body. Additionally, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ihbRf964JDXztcy3]{Disjunction} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} can force the astradaemon out of the body with a successful counteract check against DC 41.

While wearing the disguise, the astradaemon's attacks use the reach of the body it inhabits, and its size changes to match that of the creature whose soul it consumed. Additionally, the astradaemon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} while wearing the disguise. (These penalties haven't been incorporated into this stat block.)

Overtake Soul.name: Overtake Soul
Overtake Soul.description:
Requirements The astradaemon hasn't used an action with the attack trait yet this turn.

Effect The astradaemon draws out and consumes the soul of a living creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39|traits:damaging-effect] save or instantly die. If it dies, the astradaemon gains 10 temporary Hit Points.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.xiOi7btey4AS6jhe]{Effect: Overtake Soul}

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: When attacking an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature, the Skinsaw murderer deals 1d6 additional precision damage.

Twin Takedown.name: Twin Takedown
Twin Takedown.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirement You are wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand.

Effect You swiftly attack your hunted prey with both weapons. Make two Strikes against a creature, one with each of the required weapons. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of its resistances and weaknesses. Apply your multiple attack penalty to each Strike normally.

Field Of Opposition.name: Field Of Opposition
Field Of Opposition.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:42|name:Disable Thievery] (legendary) to permanently disable the planar distortion (DC increases by 2 for each duplicate still extant), or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th rank; counteract DC 42) to destroy the planar distortion
Field Of Opposition.hazarddescription: A distortion in space spawns an aggressive, malevolent shadow duplicate of any characters who pass between Terimor's faces.

Spawn Mirror Duplicate.name: Spawn Mirror Duplicate
Spawn Mirror Duplicate.description:
Trigger A creature moves between the two glass faces of Olansa Terimor

Effect The planar rift disgorges an evil mirror duplicate of the creature, and the duplicate rolls initiative.

The field of opposition can use this reaction once per round but can't spawn a duplicate of a creature that already has a mirror duplicate in existence.

Mirror Duplicate.name: Mirror Duplicate
Mirror Duplicate.description:
A mirror duplicate rolls initiative with a +45 modifier. It uses the same statistics as the original creature, but with a +2 status bonus to AC, attacks, and saving throws. The duplicate is evil, and any abilities reliant on alignment change accordingly. The duplicate is also aggressive, attacking and taking other hostile actions available to it against anyone other than mirror duplicates.

It has three actions and one reaction and can use any of the original creature's abilities. Any limited-use abilities (such as spell slots) are based on what the original had when duplicated and are used up separately from the original creature's. The duplicate also has duplicates of the creature's worn and held items, but not consumables.

A duplicate is destroyed when reduced to 0 HP, when the trap is disabled or destroyed, or when the duplicate leaves area E2. Its duplicated items disappear when they leave its grip, though they last long enough for ranged Strikes.

Lie-Master.name: Lie-Master
Lie-Master.publicNotes:
Glabrezus are looming behemoths who revel in the act of twisting mortal desires into their ultimate ruin, betraying and manipulating as easily as they breathe. Desires granted by a glabrezu always come to fruition in the most destructive way possible, turning a wish or hope into a potent and devastating act of betrayal-although the long-term repercussions are not always immediately apparent. For example, a struggling weapon smith might wish for fame and skill at their craft, only to find that their best patron is a cruel and sadistic murderer who uses the weapons in bloody sprees. Or a lonely widower might have his desire granted in the form of a lost love returned to "life" as a vampire. Glabrezus are nothing if not creative in addressing a mortal's needs.

These massive demons have enormous pincers and a pair of smaller humanoid arms sprouting from their chests, but their size belies their skill at magic, and they possess formidable innate spells. Treachery demons arise from the souls of mortals engaged in treason and deception.
Lie-Master.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Truth Vulnerability.name: Truth Vulnerability
Truth Vulnerability.description: A glabrezu's lies sustain them, and the truth can destroy them. Whenever a revelation effect counteracts or reveals the glabrezu's illusions or the glabrezu fails a save against an effect that would prevent them from lying (such as zone of truth), the demon takes @Damage[(3d6+4)[mental]] damage. They take this damage only once per effect, even if the effect reveals multiple illusions or prevents multiple lies.

Captive Rake.name: Captive Rake
Captive Rake.description:
Requirements A creature is grabbed in the glabrezu's pincer.

Effect The glabrezu pulls the grabbed creature up to 5 feet closer, then makes two claw Strikes against it. Those Strikes count as one attack when determining a treachery demon's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both Strikes.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: When a reaction would disrupt a glabrezu's spell, the demon can attempt a @Check[flat|dc:17] check, avoiding the disruption on a success.

Sudden Betrayal.name: Sudden Betrayal
Sudden Betrayal.description: A glabrezu can always use Deception when rolling initiative as long as they're aware of at least one opponent before initiative is rolled. When using Deception for initiative, the demon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception.

Tentacle Trip.name: Tentacle Trip
Tentacle Trip.description:
Trigger A creature within 15 feet of the lie-master uses a manipulate or move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:34] save or be knocked prone by the lie-master's clockwork tentacles.

Treacherous Veil.name: Treacherous Veil
Treacherous Veil.description: A glabrezu's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise} can allow it to appear as a creature of any size.

Twisted Desires.name: Twisted Desires
Twisted Desires.description: Once per month, a glabrezu can grant a mortal humanoid the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} spell granted by an Abyssal patron, though the glabrezu always perverts the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} according to their own treacherous nature.

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature targets the Copper Hand rogue with an attack, and the rogue can see the attacker

Effect The rogue dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
Poison Weapon.description: The rogue applies one of their black adder venom poisons to their wielded weapon. If their next attack with that weapon before the end of their next turn hits and deals damage, the target is afflicted with the poison.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The Copper Hand rogue deals 1d6 additional precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Chalky.name: Chalky
Chalky.publicNotes: This golem is a walking alchemical nightmare capable of inflicting all manner of painful wounds. Its ability to follow orders is granted by the otherwise mindless humanoid brain that floats in its dome-like head. In exceptionally rare cases, the brain used in its creation might retain fragments of memories or even actual intellect, resulting in an alchemical golem with a personality and agenda of its own.

Alchemical Chambers.name: Alchemical Chambers
Alchemical Chambers.description:
An alchemical golem's body contains six alchemical chambers filled with different substances. When an alchemical golem ability calls upon a randomly determined alchemical effect, roll 1d6 and consult the following :

[[/gmr 1d6 #Alchemical Effect]] Alchemical Effect
1

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}
2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.T4ouD4mVFHA3EHs6]{Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser)}
3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.oCuwJ9IUDAuzsUwa]{Bravo's Brew (Moderate)}
4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bQPRKEpnLakJBAAh]{Cat's Eye Elixir}
5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.AqLxu3ir4UGzdOaz]{Cheetah's Elixir (Moderate)}
6 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TMtQnY6yvIRCpK9v]{Juggernaut Mutagen (Greater)}

Alchemical Rupture.name: Alchemical Rupture
Alchemical Rupture.description:
When an alchemical golem takes physical damage from a critical hit or is affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell, one glass chamber within its body shatters, spewing alchemical liquid in a @Template[emanation|distance:5].

Roll on the alchemical chambers list to determine which one shatters - all creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:5] are affected by the elixir in the randomly rolled alchemical chamber, and these creatures may forego their Reflex saves against the effect if they wish.

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by sonic (@Damage[5d8[untyped]], @Damage[2d6[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by acid (area @Damage[2d4[healing]] HP); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

Vulnerable to Shatter.name: Vulnerable to Shatter
Vulnerable to Shatter.description: Casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell on an alchemical golem affects the golem normally, but also causes an alchemical rupture.

Alchemical Injection.name: Alchemical Injection
Alchemical Injection.description:
When an alchemical golem hits a creature with a syringe Strike, roll 1d6 on the alchemical chambers list to determine the additional effect of the attack.

Chalky's alchemical chambers are filled with helpful potions and elixirs rather than harmful substances. When Chalky targets an ally with its syringe Strike, the ally takes no damage and doesn't need to make a save against the rolled effect.

equipment-+1 Striking Heavy Crossbow.name: +1 Striking Heavy Crossbow
equipment-+1 Striking Heavy Crossbow.description: This large crossbow is harder to load and more substantial than a regular crossbow, but it packs a greater punch.

equipment-+2 Greater Striking axiomatic.name: +2 Greater Striking axiomatic Scourge
equipment-+2 Greater Striking axiomatic.description: A scourge-also known as a cat-o'-nine-tails-is a set of several knotted cords made from cotton or leather and attached to a handle. While most scourges are more suitable for torture than combat, the weapons used by the Order of the Scourge have metal barbs woven in to pierce clothing and armor. The scourge is a martial melee weapon.

equipment-+2 Resilient Hellknight Plate.name: +2 Resilient Hellknight Plate
equipment-+2 Resilient Hellknight Plate.description: Few armors in the Inner Sea region are as memorable as the iconic Hellknight plate. While each order has its own flourishes, Hellknight plate is instantly recognizable to any who know of the Hellknights. Hellknights go to extreme measures to punish non-Hellknights who get their hands on Hellknight plate, and the reward is not usually worth the risk, since for non-Hellknights, the armor is functionally similar to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Gq1cZWSKOtJhKd2p]{Full Plate}.

equipment-Bolts.name: Bolts
equipment-Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

Diabolic Certitude.name: Diabolic Certitude
Diabolic Certitude.description: When making a Recall Knowledge check about a devil she's observing, whenever Calennia rolls a critical failure, she gets a failure instead.

Flog Mercilessly.name: Flog Mercilessly
Flog Mercilessly.description: Calennia Strikes with her scourge. On a hit, she rolls damage three times. This damage is combined (for the purpose of overcoming damage resistance, for example).

Terrible Justice.name: Terrible Justice
Terrible Justice.description:
Trigger A living creature within 30 feet is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Calennia targets the creature with a death knell spell (DC 34). If the target dies, all of Calennia's enemies within 60 feet are targeted by a fear spell (DC 34). A creature that succeeds at either save is temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.

Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: A ravenile can hold their breath for 20 minutes.

Forced Regeneration.name: Forced Regeneration
Forced Regeneration.description:
Requirements The ravenile's regeneration is currently active

The ravenile regains @Damage[20[healing]] HP.

Furious Wallop.name: Furious Wallop
Furious Wallop.description:
Requirements The ravenile's regeneration is currently deactivated

Effect The ravenile makes a melee Strike.

This counts as two attacks for the ravenile's multiple attack penalty.

If this Strike hits, the ravenile deals an extra die of weapon damage and the target falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Shadow Step.name: Shadow Step
Shadow Step.description:
The svartalfar killer fades into shadow, Strides up to twice its Speed, and reforms.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions, but the svartalfar killer must begin and end in an area of dim light or darkness.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A svartalfar killer deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Spell-Imbued Blade.name: Spell-Imbued Blade
Spell-Imbued Blade.description:
The svartalfar killer chooses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gISYsBFby1TiXfBt]{Acid Splash}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6DfLZBl8wKIV03Iq]{Ignition}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J7Y7tl0bbdz7TcCc]{Enfeeble}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r3NeUnsgt9mS03Sn]{Shocking Grasp} and makes a melee Strike.

If the svartalfar killer hits, they cast the chosen spell through the weapon at the same target. The spell's attack roll is the same result as the Strike.

Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.name: Acidic Poison Cloud Trap
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.hp: to destroy a nozzle; Tank Hardness 20; TankHP 100 (BT 50) to damage the tank enough to stop it from spewing gas
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:35|name:Block One Nozzle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to block one of the nozzles or @Check[thievery|dc:40|name:Shut Off the Tank|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to shut off the tank. The trap deactivates after 5 rounds, once the tank is empty.
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.hazarddescription: Five nozzles hidden across the apartment's ceiling spew thick clouds of acidic poison from a reinforced tank behind the wall.
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.routine: (1 action) When it's triggered, the trap has five active nozzles, but at the end of its turn each round, one random nozzle deactivates. On the trap's turn, the active nozzles emit a cloud of acidic poison gas that expands to fill the apartment. The cloud deals @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage and @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage per active nozzle to each creature and object in the room (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic|name:Spew Cloud|traits:poison] save). Unattended objects automatically fail saves to avoid the damage.

Spew Cloud.name: Spew Cloud
Spew Cloud.description:
Trigger Twelve seconds have passed since the door to the apartment was opened

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

Life Magnet.name: Life Magnet
Life Magnet.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:29|name:Deactivate Panel|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to deactivate the panel, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th rank; counteract DC 22) to counteract the panel's magic
Life Magnet.hazarddescription: A magical magnet hidden behind a panel in the corner of the room pulls not metal but living creatures toward it, heedless of any obstacles in the way.
Life Magnet.routine:
(1 action) The trap pulls up to four creatures that have already triggered its Magnetize the Living ability toward one of the far corners of the room, possibly pressing them into the iron bars. If all the iron bars between an affected creature and the magnetic panel remain intact, the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+10)[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic|options:inflicts:restrained] save and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} on a failure ([[/act escape dc=23]]).

If an iron bar has been broken, the creature takes @Damage[(1d10+5)[bludgeoning]] damage instead, and if two consecutive bars have been broken the creature takes no damage (but might still be restrained on a failed save).
Life Magnet.reset: The trap deactivates and resets 1 minute after there are no creatures touching the iron bars.

Magnetize the Living.name: Magnetize the Living
Magnetize the Living.description:
Trigger A creature touches any of the iron bars in this area or touches a creature already affected by the trap

Effect The magical panel hidden in the far corner of the chamber (either the western or the eastern corner, depending on which side of the room the creature was closest to when it triggered the trap) "magnetizes" the triggering creature and violently pulls it toward the corner, automatically dealing @Damage[(2d10+10)[bludgeoning]] damage to the creature.

The trap then rolls initiative if it hasn't already done so.

Pest Haven.name: Pest Haven
Pest Haven.description:
The rotting hides and molding straw stuffing of skitterstitches are ideal nesting grounds for vermin and insect swarms. Any animal swarm sharing a space with a skitterstitch gains fast healing 3.

Additionally, if a creature deals at least 10 piercing or slashing damage to the skitterstitchstitch, the swarm can use its swarming bites Strike (or similar attack) against the attacker as a reaction.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.CM14G9kLI97aIC5h]{Effect: Pest Haven}

Spider Swarm Host.name: Spider Swarm Host
Spider Swarm Host.description: Skitterstitches host a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.NcYbJS5PWBGdNDqh]{Spider Swarm} within themselves, which erupts out when the Skitterstitch is destroyed

Flay.name: Flay
Flay.description: The skitterstitch makes a blade Strike against an animal or humanoid. On a success, the skitterstitch slices a long strip of flesh from the target; if the skitterstitch dealt damage, it deals an additional 1d6 persistent bleed damage.

Skitterstitch Venom.name: Skitterstitch Venom
Skitterstitch Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23|traits:poison]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds
