Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage, off-guard, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stitch Skin.name: Stitch Skin
Stitch Skin.description:
Requirements The skitterstitch hasn't used this ability since the last time it successfully used its Flay ability

Effect The skitterstitch sews flayed flesh to its body to seal tears and rents. The skitterstitch regains @Damage[8[healing]] Hit Points.

Blackfinger's Prayer.name: Blackfinger's Prayer
Blackfinger's Prayer.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:50|name:Gum Up Trapdoor|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to gum up the trapdoor's porous metal surface, @Check[crafting|dc:45|name:Render Toxin Inert] (master) to render the toxin inert, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank; counteract DC 45) to counteract the trap's magic
Blackfinger's Prayer.hazarddescription: The trapdoor's metal is infused with a deadly toxin that seeps out when the trap is triggered.

Blackfinger's Prayer.name: Blackfinger's Prayer
Blackfinger's Prayer.description:
Trigger A creature opens the door without first whispering the name Blackfingers

Effect The metal trapdoor emits toxic vapors. Each creature within 30 feet must save against a potent strain of Blackfinger Blight.

Blackfinger Blight.name: Blackfinger Blight
Blackfinger Blight.description:
Each round, at the beginning of their turn, a creature affected by blackfinger blight must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check or drop one random item they're holding

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:40]

Onset 1 round

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 round)

Integrated Launcher.name: Integrated Launcher
Integrated Launcher.description: A projectile launcher is integrated into a clockwork assassin's systems, containing 10 spinning blades and five smoke bombs. When the assassin is destroyed, the launcher and its ammunition are also destroyed.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The clockwork assassin ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description: For the clockwork assassin to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again.The assassin can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).A creature can attempt a [[/act disable-device dc=33]]{DC 31 Thievery} check to Disable a Device to wind the assassin down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the assassin is in standby mode.

Poison Ink.name: Poison Ink
Poison Ink.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 round).

Rapid Repair.name: Rapid Repair
Rapid Repair.description: The clockwork assassin spends 1 hour of its operational time to repair itself, regaining 25 Hit Points and refilling its integrated projectile launcher with 4 spinning blades (to a maximum of 10) and 2 smoke bombs (to a maximum of 5).

Smoke Bomb Launcher.name: Smoke Bomb Launcher
Smoke Bomb Launcher.description: The clockwork assassin launches a smoke bomb. A screen of thick, opaque smoke fills a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 60 feet of the clockwork assassin. Creatures within the area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The clockwork assassin's Strikes deal an additional 3d6+4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
Unbalancing Blow.description: Creatures hit by the clockwork assassin's rapier hand Strike are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the clockwork assassin's next turn.

equipment-+3 Greater Striking speed Hand.name: +3 Greater Striking speed Handwraps of Mighty Blows
equipment-+3 Greater Striking speed Hand.description:
As you invest these embroidered strips of cloth, you must meditate and slowly wrap them around your hands. These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.

Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Double Punch.name: Double Punch
Double Punch.description: Lord Guirden makes two fist Strikes, ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after both Strikes.

Hurl.name: Hurl
Hurl.description:
Requirements Lord Guirden has a Medium or smaller creature grabbed

Effect Lord Guirden hurls the grabbed creature into a target adjacent to him. He makes a fist Strike against the adjacent target. On a success, the target and hurled creature both take 3d10+14 bludgeoning damage and are knocked prone. On a failure, only the thrown creature takes the damage and is knocked prone.

Master Brawler.name: Master Brawler
Master Brawler.description: Whenever Lord Guirden makes a fist Strike and hits, he can choose to apply either the Grab, Knockdown, or Push ability to his attack.

Ink Drowning Vats.name: Ink Drowning Vats
Ink Drowning Vats.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:40|name:Seal an Ink Spout|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to seal an ink spout, @Check[thievery|dc:48|name:Unlock a Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock] (master) to unlock a steel hatch door, or @Check[athletics|dc:45|name:Force Open a Door|traits:action:force-open] (master) to Force Open a steel hatch door
Ink Drowning Vats.hazarddescription: Steel hatch doors automatically lock shut in each of the four vats labeled J2. Four ink spouts (one per vat) jut through a narrow aperture in the ceiling of each vat, 20 feet above.
Ink Drowning Vats.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action for each disabled ink spout. On each of the trap's actions, a spout pours ink, increasing the depth of the ink in that vat by 2 feet. Creatures standing in the ink are exposed to a dose of poison ink. Once the vat is full of ink, the trap stops using actions, but creatures in the vat might start drowning.
Ink Drowning Vats.reset: The trap can be reset by refilling the ink storage tanks above the vats.

Fill Tank.name: Fill Tank
Fill Tank.description:
Trigger The switch outside the vats is pulled

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

Poison Ink.name: Poison Ink
Poison Ink.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 3d6 poison damage and sickened 1 (1 round)

Stage 2 4d6 poison damage and sickened 2 (1 round)

Secret-Keeper.name: Secret-Keeper
Secret-Keeper.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. mental

equipment-+2 Striking Dagger.name: +2 Striking Dagger
equipment-+2 Striking Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

Sturdy Shield (Moderate).name: Sturdy Shield (Moderate)
Sturdy Shield (Moderate).description:
With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.

The shield has Hardness 13, HP 104, and BT 52.

equipment-Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
equipment-Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

equipment-Cape of the Mountebank.name: Cape of the Mountebank
equipment-Cape of the Mountebank.description:
This bright red-and-gold cape is often interlaced with glittery threads and serves as a distraction. While wearing the cape, you gain a +2 item bonus to Deception checks.

Activate 2 Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}. The space you leave and the one you appear in are filled with puffs of smoke that make anyone within concealed until they leave the smoke or the end of your next turn, at which point the smoke dissipates. Strong winds immediately disperse the smoke.

equipment-Religious Symbol of Norgorber.name: Religious Symbol of Norgorber
equipment-Religious Symbol of Norgorber.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Designate Apostate.name: Designate Apostate
Designate Apostate.description: Velberi designates one creature she can see within 30 feet as an apostate to the church of Norgorber, regardless of the creature's actual religious leanings. She can have up to four apostates designated at a time; any additional apostate removes another apostate of her choice. Velberi treats all Perception checks made to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive} against an apostate as one degree of success better, and her Strikes deal an additional 2d8 mental damage to apostates.

equipment-Shortbow.name: Shortbow
equipment-Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

equipment-Chain Mail.name: Chain Mail
equipment-Chain Mail.description: A suit of chain mail consists of several pieces of armor composed of small metal rings linked together in a protective mesh. It typically includes a chain shirt, leggings, a pair of arms, and a coif, collectively protecting most of the body.

equipment-Arrows.name: Arrows
equipment-Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

No Escape.name: No Escape
No Escape.description:
Trigger An enemy within reach of the Black Whale guard attempts to move away

Effect The guard Strides up to their Speed, following the enemy and keeping the enemy in reach throughout its movement until the enemy stops moving or the guard moves their full Speed.

Clobber.name: Clobber
Clobber.description: The guard makes a club Strike. On a hit, if the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:33|options:inflicts:stunned] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Hammering Flurry.name: Hammering Flurry
Hammering Flurry.description: The guard makes three club Strikes against a single target, ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after all three attacks are completed.

Shatter Defenses.name: Shatter Defenses
Shatter Defenses.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creature is within melee reach of the Black Whale guard

Effect The guard makes a melee Strike against the frightened creature. If they hit and deal damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} as long as it's frightened. If the target is already off-guard, it can't reduce its frightened value below 1 until the start of the guard's next turn.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

True Appearance.name: True Appearance
True Appearance.description:
Trigger The Stabbing Beast is transformed with Change Shape and rolls for initiative

Effect The Stabbing Beast ends Change Shape.

Blinding Stream.name: Blinding Stream
Blinding Stream.description: A creature hit by the Stabbing Beast's venom stream must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Blinded Duration]]{1d4 rounds}.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description: The Stabbing Beast takes on the appearance of a Medium humanoid with a scorpion's tail and chitinous, full-body plate armor. This doesn't change their Speed or Strikes, except that their reach becomes 5 feet and they can't make pincer Strikes.

Conjure Swords.name: Conjure Swords
Conjure Swords.description:
Requirements The Stabbing Beast is using Change Shape

Effect The Stabbing Beast summons one or two +2 greater striking keen shortswords into their hands. These weapons disappear if they leave the Stabbing Beast's grasp or if the Stabbing Beast ends Change Shape.

Stabbing Beast Venom.name: Stabbing Beast Venom
Stabbing Beast Venom.description:
While a creature is enfeebled from this poison, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round)

Clockwork Reconstruction.name: Clockwork Reconstruction
Clockwork Reconstruction.description: Each time Reginald is reborn in his lair, his machines graft him with a new clockwork modification. He chooses one of his abilities with the clockwork trait. He gains access to this ability but can't use any of his other clockwork abilities. He can't choose the same ability twice in a row. He begins with Ink Blood active.

Ink Blood.name: Ink Blood
Ink Blood.description:
Reginald's body is filled with toxic ink

Trigger An adjacent creature Strikes Reginald with a melee weapon or unarmed attack and deals damage

Effect The creature is exposed to Reginald's poison ink.

Secret of Rebirth.name: Secret of Rebirth
Secret of Rebirth.description: If a creature with less than 5 Secret Knowledge points reduces Reginald to 0 HP (or dealt the last damage to him before he dies from using Overdrive Engine), Reginald's body dissipates into a puddle of ink and releases a black wave of psychic energy. Each creature within 30 feet is bathed in a torrent of forbidden secrets and gains 1 Secret Knowledge point. Reginald's body reforms [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} later in his sanctum at full health at a location of his choosing (typically the Pool of Secrets, area L11). This ability activates automatically with no action necessary on Vancaskerkin's behalf.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description: Reginald's lungs are equipped with ink canisters, allowing him to spew a @Template[line|distance:60] of ink that deals @Damage[9d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic|options:area-effect] save; on a failure, the creature is also subjected to Reginald's poison ink).

Overdrive Engine.name: Overdrive Engine
Overdrive Engine.description:
Reginald is equipped with clockwork organs to power his body

Requirements Reginald has 175 Hit Points or fewer

Effect Reginald gains 200 temporary Hit Points, a +15-foot status bonus to Speed, and a +2 status bonus to melee attack rolls. His body begins to overheat, spewing steam that deals @Damage[9d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage at the beginning of his turn to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect] save). After 2 rounds, Reginald explodes, dealing @Damage[19d6[fire]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). Reginald dies. For the purposes of his Secret of Rebirth ability, the last creature to damage Reginald counts as killing him.

Poison Ink.name: Poison Ink
Poison Ink.description:
Reginald is immune to the toxic ink that flows through his veins

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 round).

Quill Cannon.name: Quill Cannon
Quill Cannon.description: Reginald is equipped with a cannon and hundreds of steel quills. He makes two steel quill attacks against every creature in a @Template[cone|distance:60], ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after all attacks are made. He can't use Quill Cannon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Quill Cannon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Reflective Plating.name: Reflective Plating
Reflective Plating.description: Reginald engages his defensive plating, which casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OOELvfkTedBMlWtq]{Spell Turning} on him (counteract modifier +32).

Slither.name: Slither
Slither.description: With his body composed of ink and gears, Reginald can move through tight spaces as if he were a Tiny creature, treating them as difficult terrain.

Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
Unbalancing Blow.description: Any creature a grick critically hits is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against its attacks until the end of the grick's next turn.

Vermicular Movement.name: Vermicular Movement
Vermicular Movement.description: When a grick takes a Stride action to move half its Speed or less, that movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Hidden Chute.name: Hidden Chute
Hidden Chute.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Remove Trapdoor|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to remove the trapdoor or lock it in position using a catch hidden inside the room's doorframe
Hidden Chute.hazarddescription: A trapdoor in the floor conceals a stone chute.

Pitfall.name: Pitfall
Pitfall.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the trapdoor

Effect The triggering creature falls 30 feet down the shaft to area E33, taking @Damage[15[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage and landing @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in the ochre jelly's pit. The creature can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} to avoid falling.

The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} the walls or Grab an Edge is 22.

Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description:
Il'setya can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants Il'setya the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The Il'setya's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.

Protean Anatomy 10.name: Protean Anatomy 10
Protean Anatomy 10.description:
Il'setya's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after Il'setya takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, she gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time she takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

Il'setya is immune to polymorph effects unless she is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, Il'setya automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Dimensional Slide.name: Dimensional Slide
Dimensional Slide.description:
Frequency twice per day

Effect Il'setsya steps through a transient hole in space, instantly teleporting to a space within 60 feet that she can see.

Prehensile Tail.name: Prehensile Tail
Prehensile Tail.description: Il'setsya's prehensile tail can hold and manipulate objects of Light Bulk or less, though it cannot be used to attack. She can spend an Interact action to use her tail to fetch objects stowed on her person, such as potions.

Warpwave Spell.name: Warpwave Spell
Warpwave Spell.description:
Il'setsya infuses her next spell with roiling currents of chaos.

If Il'setsya Casts a Spell before her turn is over and the spell affects a creature, that creature is also subject to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave}.

If she doesn't Cast a Spell before the beginning of her next turn, this action is wasted.

Drain Wand.name: Drain Wand
Drain Wand.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Scathka hasn't acted yet on their turn

Effect On their turn, Scathka casts one spell they've prepared and already cast this day without spending a spell slot. Scathka must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

Throw Shadow Blade.name: Throw Shadow Blade
Throw Shadow Blade.description:
Requirement Scathka is wielding a dagger

Effect Scathka draws a shadowy glyph on the dagger's blade and flings it at a nearby foe. Scathka makes a ranged Strike with the dagger with the range increment to 30 feet.

If the Strike hits, it deals @Damage[8d6[cold]] damage (double damage on a critical success) and the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn (or [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} on a critical failure).

The dagger loses its shadowy magic as soon as the attack is resolved.

equipment-Dagger.name: Dagger
equipment-Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment-+1 Striking Shortsword.name: +1 Striking Shortsword
equipment-+1 Striking Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

equipment-Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
equipment-Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment-Bloodseeker Beak.name: Bloodseeker Beak
equipment-Bloodseeker Beak.description:
This long, hollow proboscis is harvested from the notorious bloodseeker beast and drips a trickle of blood.

Activate F Envision

Trigger You hit an off-guard creature with the affixed weapon

When you activate the beak, you deal an extra 1d4 precision damage on your damage roll. If you deal sneak attack damage to the creature, you also deal @Damage[1d4[bleed]].

Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
Deny Advantage.description: The poisoner isn't off-guard to creatures of 11th level or lower that are hidden, undetected, flanking, or using surprise attack.

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger The poisoner is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see

Effect The poisoner gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Impromptu Toxin.name: Impromptu Toxin
Impromptu Toxin.description:
Cost 1 batch of infused reagents

Effect The poisoner dribbles a few experimental chemicals over a melee weapon. Until the start of their next turn, Strikes with the weapon deal an additional @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage, and targets hit by Strikes with the weapon must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27|traits:damaging-effect] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (the poisoner's choice) for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The poisoner deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
Unbalancing Blow.description: Creatures the poisoner hits with a critical hit are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against their attacks until the end of their next turn.

Exploding Statue.name: Exploding Statue
Exploding Statue.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:21|name:Safely Cut Wire|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to safely cut the wire
Exploding Statue.hazarddescription: A hollow statue filled with explosives is connected to a trip wire running along the adjacent door.

Explosion.name: Explosion
Explosion.description:
Trigger A creature opens the northern door without first disabling the trip wire

Effect The statue explodes, spraying shrapnel to the west in a @Template[cone|distance:5] and dealing @Damage[(1d10+7)[piercing],1d10[fire]]{1d10+7 piercing and 1d10 fire} damage to all creatures in the affected area (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save).

Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Integrated Launcher.name: Integrated Launcher
Integrated Launcher.description: A projectile launcher is integrated into a clockwork assassin's systems, containing 10 spinning blades and five smoke bombs. When the assassin is destroyed, the launcher and its ammunition are also destroyed.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The clockwork assassin ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description: For the clockwork assassin to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. The assassin can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).A creature can attempt a [[/act disable-device dc=33]]{DC 33 Thievery} check to Disable a Device to wind the assassin down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the assassin is in standby mode.

Rapid Repair.name: Rapid Repair
Rapid Repair.description: The clockwork assassin spends 1 hour of its operational time to repair itself, regaining 25 Hit Points and refilling its integrated projectile launcher with 4 spinning blades (to a maximum of 10) and 2 smoke bombs (to a maximum of 5).

Smoke Bomb Launcher.name: Smoke Bomb Launcher
Smoke Bomb Launcher.description: The clockwork assassin launches a smoke bomb. A screen of thick, opaque smoke fills a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 60 feet of the clockwork assassin. Creatures within the area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The clockwork assassin's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
Unbalancing Blow.description: Creatures hit by the clockwork assassin's rapier hand Strike are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the clockwork assassin's next turn.

Whirlwind Strike.name: Whirlwind Strike
Whirlwind Strike.description: The chopper makes a melee Strike against each enemy within melee reach. Its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

equipment-Shortbow.name: Shortbow
equipment-Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

equipment-Chain Mail.name: Chain Mail
equipment-Chain Mail.description: A suit of chain mail consists of several pieces of armor composed of small metal rings linked together in a protective mesh. It typically includes a chain shirt, leggings, a pair of arms, and a coif, collectively protecting most of the body.

equipment-Arrows.name: Arrows
equipment-Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

No Escape.name: No Escape
No Escape.description:
Trigger An enemy within reach of the Black Whale guard attempts to move away

Effect The guard Strides up to their Speed, following the enemy and keeping the enemy in reach throughout its movement until the enemy stops moving or the guard moves their full Speed.

Clobber.name: Clobber
Clobber.description: The guard makes a club Strike. On a hit, if the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:33|options:inflicts:stunned] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Hammering Flurry.name: Hammering Flurry
Hammering Flurry.description: The guard makes three club Strikes against a single target, ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after all three attacks are completed.

Nightmare Assault.name: Nightmare Assault
Nightmare Assault.description:
Frequency Once per day

The prison guard makes a club Strike. On a hit, the target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and becomes immune to this ability for 24 hours.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is plagued by nightmarish visions and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

Critical Failure The target becomes fatigued and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} until no longer fatigued

Shatter Defenses.name: Shatter Defenses
Shatter Defenses.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creature is within melee reach of the Black Whale guard

Effect The guard makes a melee Strike against the frightened creature. If they hit and deal damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} as long as it's frightened. If the target is already off-guard, it can't reduce its frightened value below 1 until the start of the guard's next turn.

Free Blade.name: Free Blade
Free Blade.description:
Trigger The ghaele ends its turn while unable to act or attempts a greatsword Strike that would take a circumstance or status penalty.

Effect A ghaele's blade is implacable in the pursuit of freedom, and its energies can overpower any effect that would interfere with its swordplay.

The ghaele attempts to counteract each effect that prevents it from making a greatsword Strike, gives it a penalty to its greatsword Strike, or prevents it from acting.

The ghaele can use this ability even if it's otherwise unable to act.

Light Form.name: Light Form
Light Form.description:
A ghaele's body is partially corporeal and partially composed of light, with a color corresponding to the elemental energy currently residing in its blade (see Choose Weakness).

It can move through solid objects but can't end its action within a solid object.

Choose Weakness.name: Choose Weakness
Choose Weakness.description:
A ghaele attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about a foe they are facing.

If successful, they can change the elemental damage dealt by their greatsword and light ray to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic, usually to match the foe's weakness.

They can also change their energy resistance to any of these energy types (this can be a different type than for their attacks).

The choices remain until they next use Choose Weakness.

Ghaele's Gaze.name: Ghaele's Gaze
Ghaele's Gaze.description:
When a ghaele fixes their gaze upon a non-good creature, the creature is subjected to the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree} (@Check[will|dc:20|name:Divine Decree|traits:damaging-effect] save).

If it survives, the creature is temporarily immune to for 1 minute.

Greater Holy Blade.name: Greater Holy Blade
Greater Holy Blade.description: Any weapon becomes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.rvItjGQaYT7Luwtm]{+3} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DH0kB9Wbr5pDeunX]{Holy} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.KCQRFvUgbyclvOGi]{Greater Striking} weapon while the ghaele wields it.

Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: A Shikwashim mercenary can hold their breath for 20 minutes.

Coordinated Distraction.name: Coordinated Distraction
Coordinated Distraction.description:
With a sharp whistle or wave of their hand, the mercenary distracts an opponent so one of the mercenary's allies can land a clean blow.

The mercenary chooses a target and an ally, both of whom must be within 30 feet of the mercenary. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the first Strike the mercenary's ally makes on its next turn; if the ally doesn't Strike that target, the effect is lost.

Depending on how the mercenary distracts their foe, this action gains either the auditory or visual trait.

Human Hunter.name: Human Hunter
Human Hunter.description: A Shikwashim mercenary's multiple attack penalty for attacks against humans is -3 (-2 with an agile weapon) on their second attack per turn or -6 (-4 with an agile weapon) on their third or subsequent attack per turn.

Powerful Swipe.name: Powerful Swipe
Powerful Swipe.description:
The Shikwashim mercenary makes a melee Strike. If it hits, it deals an extra die of damage.

This counts as two attacks for the mercenary's multiple attack penalty.

Terrain Advantage.name: Terrain Advantage
Terrain Advantage.description: Non-lizardfolk creatures in difficult terrain and non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a Swim speed are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to a Shikwashim mercenary.

Backdrop.name: Backdrop
Backdrop.description: When a creature attempts to Strike a living mural and critically misses, the attacker hits the surface (a wall, canvas, or so on) behind the living mural. This can damage or break the weapon or surface.

Surface-Bound.name: Surface-Bound
Surface-Bound.description:
A living mural can move only along flat surfaces such as floors and walls. This allows it to end its movement wrapped around corners when on a continuous surface.

If the surface it's on is destroyed (such as a portrait hit by a fireball spell or a puddle being splashed), the mural takes [[/r {10d6}]]{10d6 damage} and is shunted to the nearest flat surface. If there is no flat surface within 5 feet, the living mural is destroyed.

Collective Attack.name: Collective Attack
Collective Attack.description:
The subjects depicted within the living mural all reach out at once to attack. The living mural makes a fist Strike against each target within range.

These attacks count toward the living mural's multiple attack penalty, but this penalty doesn't increase until after all of the attacks are made.

Paint the Masses.name: Paint the Masses
Paint the Masses.description:
The living mural expels a @Template[cone|distance:15] of paint.

Creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:41] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

The living mural can't use Paint the Masses again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Paint the Masses]]{1d4 rounds}.

Splash of Color.name: Splash of Color
Splash of Color.description: When the living mural hits with a splatter attack, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

equipment-+2 Striking Staff.name: +2 Striking Staff
equipment-+2 Striking Staff.description: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

equipment-Bracers of Armor II.name: Bracers of Armor II
equipment-Bracers of Armor II.description: These stiff leather armguards grant you a +2 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

equipment-Disguise Kit (Elite).name: Disguise Kit (Elite)
equipment-Disguise Kit (Elite).description: This small wooden box contains cosmetics, false facial hair, spirit gum, and a few simple wigs. You usually need a disguise kit to set up a disguise in order to Impersonate someone using the Deception skill. An elite disguise kit adds a +1 item bonus to relevant checks. If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.

equipment-Healing Potion (Moderate).name: Healing Potion (Moderate)
equipment-Healing Potion (Moderate).description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[(3d8+10)[healing]] Hit Points.

Contingency Plan.name: Contingency Plan
Contingency Plan.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Kapral is targeted by an attack

Effect Kapral casts blink on herself.

Greater Planar Rift.name: Greater Planar Rift
Greater Planar Rift.disable: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank; counteract DC 46) to seal the rift
Greater Planar Rift.hazarddescription: A ragged planar rift drags things into its depths and hurls creatures through from its terminal end.

Greater Planar Rift.name: Greater Planar Rift
Greater Planar Rift.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 5 feet of the rift

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:44] save or be drawn into the rift. A creature so drawn in becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} and immediately teleports to a different random area in Kharnas's ruins.

Adamantine Strikes.name: Adamantine Strikes
Adamantine Strikes.description: Chaos Gulgamodh's body—including the appendages it uses to make melee Strikes—is made of adamantine.

Cannon Fusillade.name: Cannon Fusillade
Cannon Fusillade.description:
Chaos Gulgamodh unleashes a salvo of explosive blasts in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[(10d10+20)[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic|options:area-effect] save).

On a failed save, a creature is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave} effect. On a critically failed save, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Chaos Gulgamodh can't use Cannon Fusillade again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Cannon Fusillade]]{1d4 rounds}.

Compression.name: Compression
Compression.description: When a shredskin successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezes}, it moves through the tight space at full speed. Narrow confines are not difficult terrain for a shredskin.

Control Body.name: Control Body
Control Body.description:
Requirements The shredskin is adjacent to a Medium or Small humanoid-shaped corpse

Effect The shredskin wraps itself around the corpse and takes control of the host body. While controlling a host, the shredskin uses the host's Speed but its own attacks, and it loses its Grab and Enshroud abilities.

Attacks that target the shredskin while it controls a body deal half of the damage to the shredskin and half of the damage to the host body. Attacks that target an area deal damage to both the shredskin and host body normally.

The shredskin can release the host body as a free action at the start of its turn. If the host is destroyed, the shredskin automatically releases the body and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. A Medium corpse typically has 15 hit points, while a Small corpse typically has 10 Hit Points.

Creatures can notice that a corpse is controlled by a shredskin by succeeding a Perception check against the shredskin's Deception DC.

Enshroud.name: Enshroud
Enshroud.description:
Requirements The shredskin is grabbing a creature

Effect The shredskin attempts to pin the creature and wrap itself around the creature like a shirt. The shredskin rolls an @Check[athletics|against:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC.

On a success, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} and the shredskin can take control of the creature as if using Control Body.

At the start of its turn, the shredskin can automatically Constrict the enshrouded creature as a free action.

An enshrouded creature can attempt a [[/act escape dc=16]] check to break free ([[/act escape dc=18]] if the shredskin critically succeeded its Athletics check to Enshroud).

Charming Liar.name: Charming Liar
Charming Liar.description:
When Gage gets a critical success using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie} action, the target's attitude toward him improves by one step, as though he'd succeeded at using Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}.

This works only once per conversation, and if he critically succeeds against multiple targets using the same result, he chooses one creature's attitude to improve.

To use this ability, Gage must be lying to impart seemingly important information, inflate his status, or ingratiate himself, which trivial or irrelevant lies can't achieve.

Smooth Operator.name: Smooth Operator
Smooth Operator.description:
When Gage meets a group of up to five people, he can immediately attempt a Diplomacy check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, comparing the result to the Will DC of each target.

He takes a -3 penalty on this check, and it is possible to get different degrees of success for each target. If he fails or critically fails, he can engage in 1 minute of conversation and attempt a new check at the end of that time rather than accepting the failure or critical failure result.

Burning Chandelier Trap.name: Burning Chandelier Trap
Burning Chandelier Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:36|name:Disable a Chandelier|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable a chandelier or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 33) to permanently drain the magic from a chandelier. Any amount of cold damage that overcomes a chandelier's cold resistance extinguishes its flames and removes its persistent fire damage and flame dart attack. @Check[thievery|dc:41|name:Disable Trap (Control Panel)|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to disable the entire trap from the hidden control panel in the southeast corner of the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.hazarddescription: Four large flaming chandeliers swing wildly around the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.routine: (4 actions) For every chandelier disabled, the trap's actions are reduced by 1. For each of the trap's actions, a different chandelier attacks a random creature in the room. A chandelier uses its swinging chandelier attack if it can, but it can't make melee attacks against creatures in the cage, the closet, or the gap between the two double doors leading into the vault. Against a creature it can't reach with a melee attack, it uses a flame dart attack instead. The trap doesn't take multiple attack penalties.
Burning Chandelier Trap.reset: The trap deactivates and resets 1 minute after there are no living creatures remaining in the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.stealthdetails: (master) or @Check[perception|dc:38|traits:action:seek] (master) to spot the trap's control panel

Extending Chandeliers.name: Extending Chandeliers
Extending Chandeliers.description:
Trigger A creature touches the cage door, the closet door, or any wooden stand

Effect Both double doors leading out of the room shut and lock; while the trap is active, the key doesn't work to open these doors (although their locks can be picked normally). The chandeliers drop several feet on elongated chains, allowing them to swing around the room. The closest chandelier to the triggering creature makes a swinging chandelier Strike against it. The trap then rolls initiative.

Veksciralenix.name: Veksciralenix
Veksciralenix.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Alien Presence.name: Alien Presence
Alien Presence.description:
90 feet. A creature that first enters the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save.

Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the Veksciralenix's Alien Presence for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

Second Chance.name: Second Chance
Second Chance.description:
Frequency three times per day

Trigger Veksciralenix or a creature that Veksciralenix can see attempts a check and learns the results

Effect The triggering creature rerolls the triggering check and takes the second result.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
The time dragon breathes in one of two ways.

The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Storm The dragon breathes a burst of lightning in a @Template[cone|distance:50] that deals @Damage[20d6[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|name:Storm Breath|options:area-effect] save).

Time Displacement (arcane, transmutation) The dragon breathes a time storm. Each creature within a @Template[cone|distance:50] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:42|name:Time Displacement Breath|traits:transmutation] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 4}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 6}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: Veksciralenix makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: Veksciralenix recharges their Breath Weapon whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Integrated Launcher.name: Integrated Launcher
Integrated Launcher.description: A projectile launcher is integrated into a clockwork assassin's systems, containing 10 spinning blades and five smoke bombs. When the assassin is destroyed, the launcher and its ammunition are also destroyed.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The clockwork assassin ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description: For the clockwork assassin to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. The assassin can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).A creature can attempt a [[/act disable-device dc=31]]{DC 31 Thievery} check to Disable a Device to wind the assassin down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the assassin is in standby mode.

Rapid Repair.name: Rapid Repair
Rapid Repair.description: The clockwork assassin spends 1 hour of its operational time to repair itself, regaining 25 Hit Points and refilling its integrated projectile launcher with 4 spinning blades (to a maximum of 10) and 2 smoke bombs (to a maximum of 5).

Smoke Bomb Launcher.name: Smoke Bomb Launcher
Smoke Bomb Launcher.description: The clockwork assassin launches a smoke bomb. A screen of thick, opaque smoke fills a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 60 feet of the clockwork assassin. Creatures within the area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The clockwork assassin's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
Unbalancing Blow.description: Creatures hit by the clockwork assassin's rapier hand Strike are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the clockwork assassin's next turn.

Delay Condition.name: Delay Condition
Delay Condition.description: The binumir's dual spirit takes longer to be affected by detrimental effects. When the binumir is the target of an effect that imparts the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} condition, the condition is automatically suppressed until the end of the binumir's next turn.

Agonizing Wail.name: Agonizing Wail
Agonizing Wail.description:
The binumir unleashes a distressing cry that fills others with wrenching sadness. Creatures within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:17] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Agonizing Wail for 1 minute.

Success The target can't use reactions for 1 round.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions for 1 minute as it sobs uncontrollably. It can attempt a new Will save to end the effect at the end of each of its turns.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target can't make saves to end the effect.

Dual Assault.name: Dual Assault
Dual Assault.description:
The binumir makes four Strikes; no more than two can be against the same target.

These attacks count toward the binumir's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks have been made.

Furious Pacifier.name: Furious Pacifier
Furious Pacifier.description: Lavarsus adds double his Strength modifier to any nonlethal melee Strikes he makes with a bludgeoning weapon.

Nonlethal Training.name: Nonlethal Training
Nonlethal Training.description:
Lavarsus has trained to take down suspects without killing them.

He can choose to make nonlethal attacks with any bludgeoning weapon without taking the usual penalty to his attack roll.

Inky Tendrils.name: Inky Tendrils
Inky Tendrils.disable:
@Check[athletics|dc:48|name:Disable Athletics] (legendary) or @Check[acrobatics|dc:45|name:Disable Acrobatics] (master) to tie one tentacle into a knot, rendering it useless, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 44) to counteract one tentacle.

The death of the Daemonic Rumormonger permanently dispels all the inky tendrils.
Inky Tendrils.hazarddescription: Six giant tentacles reach up from the ink lake, grabbing any foes in reach and dragging them underwater.
Inky Tendrils.routine: (6 actions) The hazard loses 1 action for every tentacle that is disabled or destroyed. The tentacles can combine their actions to use the hazard's Inky Imitator ability. A broken tentacle can still Strike, but it can't Grab. This hazard takes no multiple attack penalty.

Black Ink Delirium.name: Black Ink Delirium
Black Ink Delirium.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 round)

Inky Imitator.name: Inky Imitator
Inky Imitator.description:
The inky tendrils cast a 10th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.73rToy0v5Ra9NvL6]{Duplicate Foe} spell (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|name:Duplicate Foe]) on the target; on a failed save, a simulacrum of the target made from dripping ink and clockwork scraps emerges from any other spot (tendrils' choice) in the lake.

The tendrils don't need to Sustain the Spell; the duplicate exists for 1 minute or until it is destroyed before collapsing into a puddle of ink and scrap metal.

Tendrils Come Alive.name: Tendrils Come Alive
Tendrils Come Alive.description:
Trigger A non-daemonic creature moves within 15 feet of the shoreline

Effect The hazard makes a tentacle Strike against the triggering creature and the hazard rolls initiative.

Jonis Flakfatter.name: Jonis Flakfatter
Jonis Flakfatter.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. disease and poison

equipment-+1 Spell Storing Dagger (conta.name: +1 Spell Storing Dagger (contains crisis of faith)
equipment-+1 Spell Storing Dagger (conta.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment-Religious Symbol (Norgorber).name: Religious Symbol (Norgorber)
equipment-Religious Symbol (Norgorber).description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

Call Toxins.name: Call Toxins
Call Toxins.description: 30 feet. Flakfatter exudes an aura that makes poisons more potent. His melee Strikes deal an additional @Damage[2d8[persistent,poison]]. Creatures in the aura attempting a flat check to remove persistent poison damage must roll twice and take the lower result. Flakfatter can suppress or resume this aura as a free action.

Infector.name: Infector
Infector.description: Flakfatter targets a creature within 30 feet that's currently subject to a poison affliction. The poison affliction progresses to the next stage.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Flakfatter's spellcasting action, he attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15] check. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Gas Trap.name: Gas Trap
Gas Trap.disable: Four @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Block Gas Vents|traits:action:disable-a-device] checks to block the gas vents, or a @Check[thievery|dc:26|name:Unlock Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock] check to unlock the door and escape
Gas Trap.hazarddescription: A spring slams and locks the room's door before four hidden gas vents begin pumping poison gas into the chamber.
Gas Trap.routine:
(1 action) Each round on its initiative count, the trap pumps more toxic gas into the room.

Any breathing creature in the room takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage (a successful @Check[fortitude|dc:22|traits:poison,damaging-effect] save halves the damage taken). If a creature acts before the trap on the first round, it has the option of holding its breath to postpone taking damage from the trap-holding one's breath after the trap's first action has no effect, since the air in the creature's lungs is already tainted. Locating and blocking one of the hidden gas vents reduces the poison damage by 1d6-if all four are blocked, the trap is disabled, though the door remains locked. Otherwise, the trap functions for 1 minute before all the gas is expended and characters in the room cease taking damage, after which the trap ventilates the room for 1 additional minute.
Gas Trap.reset: The trap must be manually rearmed by unblocking the vents or replacing the poison gas tank in area E30.
Gas Trap.stealthdetails: (trained) to smell the poison gas or hear it hissing

Toxic Gas.name: Toxic Gas
Toxic Gas.description:
Trigger A creature opens one of the drawers

Effect The door to the room slams shut and locks and the trap rolls initiative. (The trap can also be triggered manually or disarmed from area E30.)

Combustible.name: Combustible
Combustible.description: The first time each round that the Daemonic Infector takes fire damage, his fumes combust, dealing @Damage[30[fire]] damage to all other creatures within the area of his toxic fumes aura.

Toxic Fumes.name: Toxic Fumes
Toxic Fumes.description:
10 feet. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save.

On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute. In addition, creatures within the aura attempting a flat check to remove @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Poison Damage} must roll twice and take the lower result.

Breathe Death.name: Breathe Death
Breathe Death.description:
The Daemonic Infector exhales a @Template[line|distance:30] of concentrated fumes.

Each creature in the area takes @Damage[12d10[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:44|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:drained] save; on a critical failure the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}).

The Infector can't Breathe Death again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Death]]{1d4 rounds}.

Infector.name: Infector
Infector.description: The Daemonic targets a creature within 30 feet that's currently subject to a poison affliction. The poison affliction progresses to the next stage.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the Daemonic Infector's spellcasting action, he attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15] check. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Magic Susceptibility.name: Magic Susceptibility
Magic Susceptibility.description:
An almiraj takes a -2 status penalty to saving throws against occult spells.

Any beneficial occult spells with a duration of 1 round or longer cast on the almiraj last twice as long.

Magic Horn.name: Magic Horn
Magic Horn.description:
Any living creature slain by the almiraj's horn Strike immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} with no saving throw, in addition to dying.

A severed almiraj horn retains a wisp of its former magic; in combat, the horn can be wielded as a +1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.rQWaJhI5Bko5x14Z]{Dagger} or, if affixed to a shaft, a +1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.tOhoGvmCMw4JpWcS]{Spear}

equipment-Dagger.name: Dagger
equipment-Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment-Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
equipment-Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

equipment-Poisoner's Staff.name: Poisoner's Staff
equipment-Poisoner's Staff.description:
This gnarled staff is covered with thorns and coated with a glistening lacquer that acts as a minor irritant. While holding the staff, you aren't affected by its coating or thorns, and you reduce the DC of your flat checks to overcome persistent poison damage from 15 to 13.

Activate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell}

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

  • Cantrips @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Guidance}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.QqxwHeYEVylkYjsO]{Detect Poison}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.DYdvMZ8G2LiSLVWw]{Spider Sting}

Venom Explosion.name: Venom Explosion
Venom Explosion.description:
Trigger The venom mage is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The venom mage explodes into a cloud of poison within a @Template[burst|distance:20]. The venom mage then reforms at a point they choose within the burst, avoids being knocked out, and remains at 1 Hit Point. The venom mage's wounded value increases by 1 when they use this ability, and they can't use this ability when they're wounded 3 or more. Creatures other than the venom mage within the burst must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success No effect.

Success The creature is sickened 1.

Failure The creature is sickened 2 and cannot recover from the sickened condition while within 20 feet of the venom mage.

Critical Failure As failure, but sickened 4.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt the venom mage's spellcasting action, the venom mage attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15] check. If the venom mage succeeds, their action isn't disrupted.

Grabble Forden.name: Grabble Forden
Grabble Forden.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency 7 times per day

Requirements Grabble hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect Grabble can cast one prepared spell he has already cast today without spending a spell slot. He must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements. He can do this once per day for each of the spell ranks he can cast.

Poison Conversion.name: Poison Conversion
Poison Conversion.description:
Frequency 3 times per day

Effect If Grabble's next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is 6th rank or lower and deals acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage, the spell deals poison damage rather than its normal damage type and gains the poison trait.

Franca Laurentz.name: Franca Laurentz
Franca Laurentz.allSaves: +2 circumstance bonus to saves vs. poison

+2 Circumstance Bonus on Saves vs. Poiso.name: +2 Circumstance Bonus on Saves vs. Poison

Deflective Dodge.name: Deflective Dodge
Deflective Dodge.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting Franca fails or critically fails

Effect Franca can choose to either Step or redirect the attack to a creature that is adjacent to her and within the reach of the triggering attack.

The attacker rerolls the Strike's attack roll against the new target.

Bloody Rebel.name: Bloody Rebel
Bloody Rebel.description:
Franca quickly slashes at nearby foes, aiming to maim rather than disable. She makes up to three melee Strikes, each against a different creature within reach.

These Strikes count toward Franca's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all three Strikes are made.

On a hit, the Strike deals @Damage[3[bleed]] damage instead of its normal damage.

On a critical hit, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of Franca's next turn or until they spend an action to remove the condition, whichever comes first.

Hamstring.name: Hamstring
Hamstring.description:
Requirements Franca's last action was a melee Strike that dealt sneak attack damage to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} target

Effect Franca deals @Damage[6[bleed]] damage to the target creature, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Franca's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Splash Poison.name: Splash Poison
Splash Poison.description:
Franca uncorks and flings a dose of poison at a bleeding foe.

She retrieves a poison from her inventory, then splashes it at a creature within 10 feet that is currently taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:32] save or be exposed to the poison.

Efficient Winding.name: Efficient Winding
Efficient Winding.description:
For the clockwork amalgam to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 7 days, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again.

The amalgam can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt a [[/act disable-device dc=33]]{DC 33 Thievery} check to Disable a Device to wind the amalgam down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the amalgam is in standby mode.

Recalibrate.name: Recalibrate
Recalibrate.description: The clockwork amalgam can recalibrate its internal structure to shed damaged components and replace them with new ones, restoring 125 HP to the construct. Each time it uses this ability, the clockwork amalgam permanently deactivates one of its five melee attacks as the components from that arm reassemble within the core of the machine.

Whirring Doom.name: Whirring Doom
Whirring Doom.description:
Frequency once per round

The clockwork amalgam becomes a blur of spinning weaponry. It makes up to five melee Strikes (one for each active melee attack it has available), taking a -4 penalty to the attack roll for each attack, but ignoring the multiple attack penalty until it has made all of its attacks. It can use each melee attack only once and it can target each creature in reach only once. If the clockwork amalgam used Whirring Doom in the previous round, it can use it again this round using only 1 action instead of 3. The amalgam's movement Speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).name: Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil)
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).disable: @Check[perception|dc:18|name:Notice the Trap's Magic|traits:action:seek] to notice the trap's magic and avoid stepping on the floor outside the circle, followed by @Check[thievery|dc:21|name:Break Summoning Circle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to break the circle or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd rank; counteract DC 23) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).hazarddescription: A summoning circle inlaid into the room's floor detects living creatures and summons a violent devil.
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).reset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

Summon Devil.name: Summon Devil
Summon Devil.description:
Trigger A living creature steps on any part of the floor not enclosed by the summoning circle

Effect One round after a creature touches the triggering area, the door to the room slams shut and locks (two [[/act pick-a-lock dc=20]]{Thievery} checks to pick) and a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.FIoRPHaHdYUPVKdT]{Barbazu} devil appears in the summoning circle.

The devil rolls initiative and remains for [[/br 3d6 #rounds]]{3d6 rounds}, after which the spell ends and the devil disappears. The devil also disappears if someone disables the trap before the duration expires.

The summoned devil can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.

Clockwork Poison Bomb.name: Clockwork Poison Bomb
Clockwork Poison Bomb.hp: to ruin the nozzle (making it impossible to disable, in which case the only way to disarm the bomb is to destroy both its tanks); Tank Hardness 15; Tank HP 80 (BT 40) to destroy one of the tanks (both tanks must be destroyed to disarm the bomb
Clockwork Poison Bomb.disable: Three [[/act disable-device dc=31]]{DC 31 Thievery} (expert) checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device} to disable the latches that lock the nozzle in place, then one [[/act disable-device dc=35]]{DC 35 Thievery} (master) check to Disable a Device to turn off the nozzle; DCs decrease by 2 if Oggvurm is immobilized, paralyzed, unconscious, or dead
Clockwork Poison Bomb.hazarddescription: A clockwork bomb releases gouts of poisonous smoke. The smoke issues forth from a single nozzle attached to two tanks of pressurized poison
Clockwork Poison Bomb.routine: (1 action) On its turn, the bomb spews forth a smoky gout of airborne @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.WvDbdESFJY6Be2u1]{Blackfinger Blight} poison. The cloud fills a 20-foot radius, or a 10-foot radius if only one tank remains intact. If the bomb is already in the center of a blackfinger blight cloud, the radius of that cloud increases by 20 feet (or 10 feet, if only one tank remains intact) instead.
Clockwork Poison Bomb.reset: The trap issues smoke for 3 minutes before its tanks run dry. The tanks must be replaced before the bomb can be reactivated.
Clockwork Poison Bomb.stealthdetails: The bomb uses Oggvurm's initiative roll as its Stealth roll

Poisonous Cloud.name: Poisonous Cloud
Poisonous Cloud.description:
Trigger The bomb is Activated, which requires 3 actions

Effect The bomb releases a smoky cloud of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.WvDbdESFJY6Be2u1]{Blackfinger Blight} in a 20-foot radius. Creatures within the smoke are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from other creatures.

Any creature that starts its turn in the smoke must roll a @Check[fortitude|dc:32|name:Blackfinger Blight|traits:contact,virulent] saving throw to avoid being afflicted by blackfinger blight poison.

The cloud remains for 1 minute or until dispersed by strong winds.

Ferocious Devotion.name: Ferocious Devotion
Ferocious Devotion.description:
When an illusory toady is destroyed, it dissolves into a puddle of cerulean quintessence before reforming to quasi-life once more. One round after it is destroyed, the toady starts re-forming. One round after that, the toady is completely healed and begins to fight once more.

If damaged while it is re-forming but before the process is complete, the toady is destroyed but splits into two cerulean puddles that begin re-forming into two identical toadies 1 round later, each with half the maximum HP of the original toady (this is similar to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.uQBOJfjtzEXvpLQz]{Ochre Jelly's} Split ability); the toadies begin re-forming 1 round later.

The toadies are permanently destroyed only by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ihbRf964JDXztcy3]{Disjunction} or if @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.agents-of-edgewatch-bestiary.Actor.sUrJ7jxzBiJTbwVo]{Blune} falls unconscious.

Amplify Spell.name: Amplify Spell
Amplify Spell.description:
The toady wills itself to become a conduit for Blune's next spell, empowering the spell.

The toady becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until the beginning of its next turn.

If Blune Bandersworth is within 30 feet and Casts a Spell before the toady's next turn, the spell travels through the toady before redirecting toward its intended target.

The spell is heightened by 1 rank, to a maximum of 10th rank. The toady is then destroyed.

Dirty Bomb.name: Dirty Bomb
Dirty Bomb.description:
Requirements The chemist has at least one bomb in their possession

Effect The chemist adds a hasty mix of noxious substances to the bomb and makes a ranged Strike with it. If it hits and deals damage, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}; if the result of the save is a critical failure, this increases to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}. For the next 24 hours, the affected target takes a -2 circumstance penalty (-3 on a critical failure) to additional Fortitude saving throws against the same chemist's Crude Bombs.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.5ZK22sNW7o26aST0]{Effect: Dirty Bomb}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.ryY6fdqpC5Ztnagd]{Effect: Dirty Bomb (Critical Failure)}

Quick Brew.name: Quick Brew
Quick Brew.description:
Requirements The chemist has their alchemist's tools, formula book, and a free hand

Effect The chemist creates a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Moderate Acid Flask} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire} that they must use before the end of their next turn or else it becomes inert.

Supplicant Statues.name: Supplicant Statues
Supplicant Statues.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:34|name:Disable Statue Rollers|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable a specific statue's rollers, or @Check[thievery|dc:39|name:Disable Trap (Control Panel)|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on the control panel in A4 deactivates the whole trap. For each statue disabled, the trap loses 1 action from its routine and the DC for its predictive impediment ability decreases by 4. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th rank, counteract DC 32) doesn't harm the statues but removes the predictive impediment ability. Breaking the control panel prevents the trap from resetting.
Supplicant Statues.hazarddescription: Six statues rapidly slide around the room on rollers, slowing down intruders and striking at them with spring-loaded sword arms.
Supplicant Statues.routine: (6 actions) On the trap's initiative, each functioning statue slides up to 40 feet around the room and makes a statue shortsword Strike against an adjacent creature. The trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty, and the statues' movements don't trigger reactions.
Supplicant Statues.reset: The trap deactivates and resets one minute after the room is empty.

Animated Statues.name: Animated Statues
Animated Statues.description:
Trigger A creature enters a square adjacent to a statue

Effect The trap makes a statue shortsword Strike against the triggering creature, activates its predictive impediment ability, and then rolls initiative.

Predictive Impediment.name: Predictive Impediment
Predictive Impediment.description: The statues continually slide around to bump into creatures and block their passage through the room. The first time on its turn that a creature attempts to move within the room, it must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:36] save or treat the entire room as difficult terrain for 1 round. On a critical failure, the creature is also knocked prone.

Waxworks Onslaught Trap.name: Waxworks Onslaught Trap
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.hp: to destroy a tub and prevent it from making any further attacks; Door Seal Hardness 18; Door Seal HP 72 (BT 36) to destroy the wax on a sealed door and allow anyone to escape through the door
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43|name:Drain Wax from a Tub|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to drain the wax from a tub or @Check[athletics|dc:45|name:Push Through Wax|traits:action:force-open] (master) to push through the wax blocking a sealed door and escape (other creatures must push their own way through, as the wax reseals)
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.hazarddescription: Four huge tubs containing congealed wax, enchanted to melt and envelop unwary intruders, each sit atop a cold fire.
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn per drained or destroyed tub.
