On each action, a different tub spews hot wax at a random creature in the room, dealing @Damage[3d12[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to the target and all adjacent creatures (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic|options:area-effect] save). On a failure or critical failure, the creature is also encased in hot wax. A creature that starts its turn encased in wax takes @Damage[8d12[fire]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it [[/act escape dc=35]]{Escapes} the hardening wax. Each turn it remains encased, the damage dealt by the hot wax decreases by 2d12 but the DC to Escape increases by 2 (minimum 0 damage, maximum DC 43). A creature that can't get free from the wax might suffocate.
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 hour. At that time, the wax in the tubs cools and congeals, and any wax elsewhere in the room magically goes back into the tubs.

Seal Room.name: Seal Room
Seal Room.description:
Trigger A creature comes within 5 feet of a tub

Effect The fires beneath the vats blaze to life, magically melting the wax in the tubs. The tubs emit gouts of wax over the room's exits, sealing them shut. The trap then rolls initiative.

Water Elemental Vessel (I2).name: Water Elemental Vessel (I2)
Water Elemental Vessel (I2).publicNotes: Spellcasters create elemental vessels by harvesting raw elemental energy and then binding it within a specially enchanted magic circle to grant it life.

Spell Circle.name: Spell Circle
Spell Circle.description: By performing an hour-long ritual, an elemental vessel can form a spell circle with an arcane or primal spellcaster. After the spell circle is formed, other spellcasters can join the spell circle by performing the same hour-long ritual while assisted by at least one spellcaster already in the spell circle. Each member of the spell circle must contribute at least one spell to the elemental vessel. The spellcaster permanently loses access to a spell slot equal to the spell's rank and the elemental vessel adds the contributed spell to its list of arcane innate spells (regardless of the spell's original type). An elemental vessel can be imbued with no more than three spells per spell rank. If the elemental vessel is destroyed, all members of the spell circle regain the spell slots they contributed to the creature. The arcane innate spells shown below represent a typical spell list for an elemental vessel, but each elemental vessel is likely to have different spells depending on what its spell circle has contributed.

Dispel Vulnerability.name: Dispel Vulnerability
Dispel Vulnerability.description: Whenever a creature successfully counteracts one of its spells, the vessel permanently loses access to that spell and takes damage equal to 4 × the spell's rank. The spell circle member who contributed that spell regains access to their contributed spell slot.

Inhabit Vessel.name: Inhabit Vessel
Inhabit Vessel.description: Any member of the elemental vessel's spell circle can spend 3 actions to mentally inhabit the vessel for 1 round. While they inhabit the vessel, the inhabiter controls the vessel's actions, and the vessel uses the inhabiter's Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma modifiers for all checks. Only one creature can inhabit an elemental vessel at a time.

Engulf.name: Engulf
Engulf.description:
@Check[reflex|dc:35] save, no damage, [[/act escape dc=35]], Rupture 28

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Engulf]

Internal Spell Strike.name: Internal Spell Strike
Internal Spell Strike.description: The elemental vessel targets an engulfed creature with one of its spells. The spell must have a range of touch.

Sword Cane Duelist.name: Sword Cane Duelist
Sword Cane Duelist.description: Each round, Pratchett can Strike once with each component of a sword cane without incurring the usual multiple attack penalty. Subsequent attacks incur the multiple attack penalty as usual.

equipment-+1 Striking Morningstar.name: +1 Striking Morningstar
equipment-+1 Striking Morningstar.description: This weapon has a short shaft ending in a metal ball studded with spikes.

equipment-Sling.name: Sling
equipment-Sling.description: Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.

equipment-Breastplate.name: Breastplate
equipment-Breastplate.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

equipment-Sling Bullets.name: Sling Bullets
equipment-Sling Bullets.description: These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

Little Favors.name: Little Favors
Little Favors.description: Each time a creature willingly performs a service, quest, or task for the zealborn, the creature takes a cumulative -1 status penalty to saving throws against the zealborn's mental spells and abilities (maximum -4).

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a zealborn is destroyed, it re-forms, fully healed, near a follower of its choice in [[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}. For the purposes of rejuvenation, a follower is defined as an intelligent creature who's well acquainted with the zealborn and is a true believer in the zealborn's mission, not merely a lukewarm supporter. A zealborn can be permanently destroyed only if they have no current followers or can be convinced to end their own life.

Zealous Restoration.name: Zealous Restoration
Zealous Restoration.description: A zealborn can't regain Hit Points through resting or void healing; they feed only on the idealism of their supporters, regaining 10 Hit Points per day for each creature under the effects of a geas cast by the zealborn. Creatures under a zealborn's geas have their maximum HP reduced by 10 each day until they are burned away to a husk and perish. After 24 hours, such creatures rise as zeal-damned ghouls under the zealborn's control. Zeal-damned ghouls eat only the flesh of evil or chaotic creatures and deal an additional 1d6 spirit and 1d6 void damage with their attacks.

Hypnotic Glow.name: Hypnotic Glow
Hypnotic Glow.description: 30 feet. Similar to other will-o'-wisps, a gloaming will-o'-wisp is naturally invisible, but glows with a faint colored light. They cast dim light in the aura, which makes them visible. In addition, any non-aberration creature that ends their turn in the aura and can see the gloaming will-o'-wisp is distracted by the gloaming will-o'-wisp's glow and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:31] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round and takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity
Magic Immunity.description: A will-o'-wisp is immune to all spells except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}.

Feed on Fear.name: Feed on Fear
Feed on Fear.description:
Requirement An enemy is under a fear effect or dying within 15 feet of the will-o'-wisp

Effect The will-o'-wisp feeds on the creature's terror. They regains 4d8 Hit Points, and if they've Gone Dark, their glow reignites. A will-o'-wisp can take this action only once per round.

Go Dark.name: Go Dark
Go Dark.description: The gloaming will-o'-wisp extinguishes their hypnotic glow, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. They can end this effect with another use of this action. If they use their shock attack while invisible, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine their location, making the will-o'-wisp only @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to observers until they move.

Opportune Dodge.name: Opportune Dodge
Opportune Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature critically fails a Strike against the Daemonic Rumormonger

Effect The Rumormonger dodges out of the way and uses his momentum to attack and move out of reach. He Strides up to 20 feet and can Strike at any point during this movement; this Strike counts toward the multiple attack penalty on his next turn.

Black Ink Delirium.name: Black Ink Delirium
Black Ink Delirium.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 round)

Breath of Lies.name: Breath of Lies
Breath of Lies.description:
The Daemonic Rumormonger breathes a torrent of acidic sand and poisoned ink in an @Template[line|distance:80], dealing @Damage[6d12[acid],6d12[poison]|options:area-damage]{6d12 acid damage and 6d12 poison damage} and exposing victims to his black ink delirium.

He can't use Breath of Lies again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath of Lies]]{1d4 rounds}.

Whirling Slashes.name: Whirling Slashes
Whirling Slashes.description: The Daemonic Rumormonger Strides up to his Speed. He can make up to three claw Strikes, each against a different target, at any points during this Stride. His multiple attack penalty applies as usual.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The Copper Hand illusionist deals 2d6 additional precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Double Stab.name: Double Stab
Double Stab.description:
Requirements Ralso is wielding two piercing weapons

Frequency once per round

Effect Ralso makes two Strikes against a single creature within reach, one Strike per weapon.

These attacks count toward Ralso's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Ralso deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Freezing Alarm.name: Freezing Alarm
Freezing Alarm.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:53|name:Disable Arcana] (legendary) to draw a fiery counteracting glyph over each snowflake, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank, counteract DC 48)
Freezing Alarm.hazarddescription: Miniature snowflake-shaped glyphs on the ground cause a layer of ice to ripple over the floor of the room and sound a silent alarm.

Freeze Floor.name: Freeze Floor
Freeze Floor.description:
Trigger A creature enters one of the three squares marked with a T on the map

Effect The floor of the entire 10-foot-by-15-foot antechamber freezes over, sending deadly magical frost creeping up the legs of the intruders. Any creatures standing in the room must roll a @Check[reflex|dc:45] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[(3d10+5)[cold]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[(6d10+10)[cold]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[(12d10+20)[cold]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

Additionally, the golems in area B10 become aware of the intruders. The golems activate and come to this room to attack, if they haven't been destroyed already.

Rhevanna.name: Rhevanna
Rhevanna.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Plunder Life.name: Plunder Life
Plunder Life.description:
60 feet. When a healing effect restores Hit Points to a non-fiend creature in the aura, the amount of Hit Points restored is halved. The rhevanna gains temporary Hit Points equal to the amount of Hit Points restored.

The rhevanna loses any remaining temporary Hit Points after 1 minute.

Detaining Strike.name: Detaining Strike
Detaining Strike.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger The rhevanna hits a creature with a weapon Strike

Effect The rhevanna casts an innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ksLCg62cLOojw3gN]{Planar Tether} spell on the creature.

Lifedrinker.name: Lifedrinker
Lifedrinker.description:
Trigger The rhevanna kills a living creature of at least 16th level

Effect The rhevanna drinks the triggering creature's life force and regains @Damage[40[healing]] Hit Points. If the triggering creature is a celestial, the rhevanna instead regains @Damage[80[healing]] Hit Points.

Malefic Binding.name: Malefic Binding
Malefic Binding.description:
The rhevanna can target celestials with their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul} ability, and a gem containing a celestial bound by a rhevanna has Hardness 40.

If the rhevanna destroys a gem in which they placed a celestial, the celestial is destroyed forever.

The Laughing Fiend's Greeting.name: The Laughing Fiend's Greeting
The Laughing Fiend's Greeting.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:44|name:Disable Thievery] (legendary) to obscure or mar the magical runes set into the mural, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank; counteract DC 42) to counteract the mural
The Laughing Fiend's Greeting.hazarddescription: Subtle but deadly magical runes link this mural to Kharnas's master. Good- or neutral-aligned creatures who examine the mural witness the castle's drawbridge silently descend, revealing an endless darkness.

Tegresin's Greeting.name: Tegresin's Greeting
Tegresin's Greeting.description:
Trigger A creature capable of casting divine magic examines the mural

Effect The mural casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qDjeG6dxT4aEEC6J]{Weird} (@Check[will|dc:43|traits:death,emotion,fear,illusion,mental,damaging-effect] save) on all creatures in the gallery. A snarl fills the creatures' minds.

Canopy Drop.name: Canopy Drop
Canopy Drop.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:23|name:Jam Trapdoor Mechanism|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to jam the mechanisms and keep the trapdoor from opening, or to locate the bypass switch hidden under a stair riser just outside the room
Canopy Drop.hazarddescription: A trapdoor, connected to floor sensors, opens in the section of floor marked on the map, while the surrounding floor suddenly tilts to a 45-degree angle and the fountains in the wall begin spraying at high pressure, making the tile slippery and pushing creatures toward the open chute.

Flush.name: Flush
Flush.description:
Trigger Two or more creatures stand on the trapped spaces

Effect One round after the trap is triggered, all creatures in the room fall 40 feet down the shaft to area E36, taking @Damage[20[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage from the fall plus @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage as they land in the spiked pit.

The creatures can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} to snag the hammock or one of the hanging storage containers to avoid falling.

The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} the walls or Grab an Edge is 20.

Hestriviniaas.name: Hestriviniaas
Hestriviniaas.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description:
Hestriviniaas can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Protean Anatomy 25.name: Protean Anatomy 25
Protean Anatomy 25.description:
Hestriviniaas' vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the Hestriviniaas takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type.

This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The keketar is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target.

If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the keketar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Spatial Riptide.name: Spatial Riptide
Spatial Riptide.description:
30 feet. A creature using a teleportation ability within the aura or arriving in it via teleportation must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:45] save or wink out of existence for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} before completing the teleport. The creature can't act, sense anything, or be targeted. On a successful save, the creature completes the teleport normally but is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Keketars are immune to this effect.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Hestriviniaas can take the appearance of any Gargantuan or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Reshape Reality.name: Reshape Reality
Reshape Reality.description: When Hestriviniaas casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage}, it infuses the illusion with quasi-real substance. Creatures that do not disbelieve the illusion treat structures and terrain created through the spell as though they were real, ascending illusory stairs, becoming trapped by illusory quicksand, and so on.

Warpwave Strike.name: Warpwave Strike
Warpwave Strike.description: A creature struck by Hestriviniaas' jaws or claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:45] save or be subject to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave}.

The Winder.name: The Winder
The Winder.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:50|name:Deactivate System|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to deactivate the system, or @Check[athletics|dc:40|name:Jam Gears] (legendary) to jam the gears for 1 round
The Winder.hazarddescription: A large metallic arm, 20 feet long, is set into the floor. It rotates around the room to wind up nearby clockwork creatures.
The Winder.routine: (1, 2, or 4 actions, depending on the encounter's threat level) The Winder uses each of its actions to Wind clockwork assassins in the room, starting with inactive ones.
The Winder.reset: The Winder resets as soon as no creatures remain in the room.

Wind Up.name: Wind Up
Wind Up.description:
Trigger A creature other than the Rumormonger enters the room, or the Rumormonger commands the device to activate

Effect The Winder rolls initiative.

Wind.name: Wind
Wind.description: The Winder winds a clockwork creature in the room. If the creature is currently inactive, this activates the creature, allowing it to act normally for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. If already active, this instead increases the number of rounds the clockwork creature remains active by 1d4.

Explosive Barrels.name: Explosive Barrels
Explosive Barrels.disable: @Check[survival|dc:20|name:Smother the Flames] to smother the flames without rupturing the barrels
Explosive Barrels.hazarddescription: Wooden barrels marked with an oil-drop symbol catch fire and explode.

Explode.name: Explode
Explode.description:
Trigger 4 rounds pass after the agents' arrival without anyone smothering them

Effect The barrels explode, dealing @Damage[(3d6+8)[fire]] damage to everything within a 20-foot radius (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|traits:fire] save).

Bloody Chain Aura.name: Bloody Chain Aura
Bloody Chain Aura.description:
20 feet. Chains of blood bind a bleeding creature to the Daemonic Skinner.

Creatures in range that are taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} can't move out of the aura.

The Skinner can have only one aura active at a time.

She can switch her active aura as an Interact action.

Spell Choke.name: Spell Choke
Spell Choke.description:
Trigger A creature taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} within 30 feet of the Daemonic Skinner Casts a Spell with a verbal component or speaks

Effect The Skinner wills the triggering creature's blood to gush from their mouth and constrict their throat. The target's spell is disrupted.

The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:47] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Transfusion Aura.name: Transfusion Aura
Transfusion Aura.description:
30 feet. Any time a creature in the aura takes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}, the Daemonic Skinner regains the same number of Hit Points as the damage dealt.

The Skinner can have only one aura active at a time.

She can switch her active aura as an Interact action.

Bloody Sneak Attack.name: Bloody Sneak Attack
Bloody Sneak Attack.description: Any creature taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the Daemonic Skinner's attacks. When attacking an off-guard creature, the Skinner deals an additional 2d6 precision damage.

Hook and Flay.name: Hook and Flay
Hook and Flay.description:
Requirements The Daemonic Skinner has a creature grabbed with her blood chain or a creature is affected by her bloody chain aura

Effect The Skinner pulls the creature into the nearest open adjacent square and makes a cleaver Strike against the creature.

equipment-+1 Striking Composite Shortbow.name: +1 Striking Composite Shortbow
equipment-+1 Striking Composite Shortbow.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

equipment-+1 Leather Armor.name: +1 Leather Armor
equipment-+1 Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment-Religious Symbol (norgorber).name: Religious Symbol (norgorber)
equipment-Religious Symbol (norgorber).description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

equipment-Arrows.name: Arrows
equipment-Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

equipment-Arrows With Shadow Essence.name: Arrows With Shadow Essence
equipment-Arrows With Shadow Essence.description:
These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

Infused with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Wjkw0lEUOhypYvzo]{Shadow Essence}

Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Toxic Mastery.name: Toxic Mastery
Toxic Mastery.description: Kalyn can masterfully manipulate vile, poisonous energy and increase its potency. Her melee and ranged Strikes deal an additional 2d6 poison damage, and a target that takes this poison damage has a -1 status penalty to saving throws against Kalyn's divine spells for 1 round. Poisons delivered by Kalyn have the virulent trait.

Ixusoth.name: Ixusoth
Ixusoth.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

equipment-Robe of Eyes.name: Robe of Eyes
equipment-Robe of Eyes.description:
This garment appears to be an ordinary robe until donned, at which point numerous strange and alien eyes of varied shapes and colors open and blink across its fabric. While wearing the robe, you gain a +3 item bonus to Perception checks, and you constantly benefit from the effects of a 2nd-rank see @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} spell.

You can also see powerful magic auras. The highest-level magic aura within 30 feet of you glows in a color that reveals its school to you and allows you to determine where the effect originates. This can narrow down the origin point of the effect to a 5-foot-cube, but not more precisely than that.

The robe of eyes is not without its dangers. If any spell with the light trait is cast on you or your square while you are wearing the robe, you are blinded for a number of rounds equal to the spell's rank unless you succeed at a Fortitude save against the spell's DC.

Activate A Interact

Effect You pluck an eye from the robe and toss it into the air, where it turns invisible and floats to a destination you choose, with the same effect as a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ek5XI0aEdZhBgm21]{Scouting Eye} spell. You can Sustain the Activation just as you would be able to Sustain the Spell.

Lore Master.name: Lore Master
Lore Master.description: Ixusoth retains a vast amount of knowledge. She can use her Bardic Lore skill to Recall Knowledge on any topic, and she knows any languages common to an area she has spent a day or more in.

Eye Probe.name: Eye Probe
Eye Probe.description:
Frequency once per day

Up to six of Ixusoth's eyes detach from her body. Each eye has AC 26, HP 1, and a fly speed of 40 feet. Ixusoth can see through all of her eye probes. She can move the probes all in separate directions using a single action. Ixusoth can have no more than six eye probes active at a time; using this ability to create more eyes causes the eye or eyes farthest away to shrivel and die.

Ixusoth can deliver touch spells through her eye probes and make melee spell attacks through them. In addition, she can Steal Memories through an eye probe using a single action by touching the target with the eye.

Scatterbrain Palm.name: Scatterbrain Palm
Scatterbrain Palm.description:
A creature hit by Ixusoth's fist Strike must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36|options:inflicts:stunned] save. The creature is then temporarily immune until the start of its next turn.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}, and the hyakume can use Steal Memories on the target as part of this action.

Steal Memories.name: Steal Memories
Steal Memories.description: Ixusoth reaches out with her mind and attempts to steal memories from a creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:40] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and have some of its memories stolen. When Ixusoth steals memories, she learns some of the creature's memories (chosen by the GM). These memories are then lost to that creature.

Sordesdaemon.name: Sordesdaemon
Sordesdaemon.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Miasma of Pollution.name: Miasma of Pollution
Miasma of Pollution.description:
30 feet. Creatures in the aura can't reduce the value of the sickened condition.

A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn in it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:34] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it is sickened on a critical failure).

A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Creatures made of water (such as water elementals) and plant creatures use an outcome one degree of success worse than the result of their save.

Pollution Infusion.name: Pollution Infusion
Pollution Infusion.description:
Non-fiend creatures adjacent to the afflicted creature take a -1 circumstance penalty to saving throws against disease

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 week)

Stage 5 dead.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.gORyINQLvplfthlm]{Effect: Pollution Infusion}

Retch of Foulness.name: Retch of Foulness
Retch of Foulness.description:
The sordesdaemon exhales a spray of sewage that deals @Damage[8d6[acid],8d6[poison]|options:area-damage]{8d6 acid damage and 8d6 poison damage} in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect] save).

It can't use Retch of Foulness again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Retch of Foulness]]{1d4 rounds}.

Prospecti Statue.name: Prospecti Statue
Prospecti Statue.publicNotes: As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

Construct Armor (Hardness 10).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
Construct Armor (Hardness 10).description: Like normal objects, a giant animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a giant animated statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 22.

Stone Robes.name: Stone Robes
Stone Robes.description:
The Prospecti statue turns suddenly, causing its robes, which flow like fabric despite being as hard as stone, to swing about and damage opponents.

Creatures adjacent to the animated statue take @Damage[(2d6+6)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save; on a critical failure, the creature is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}).

Carvey.name: Carvey
Carvey.publicNotes: Made of odd scraps of skin and muscle, a flesh golem is a grotesque parody of life. Though it has no mind, it can still go into a berserk rage when harmed, giving it a faint semblance of emotion. Flesh golems guard the laboratories and charnel houses of fleshwarpers and necromancers who feel no compunctions about desecrating corpses for their own ends. Though the first flesh golem is believed to have been a misguided attempt to create from simple base elements, these monstrosities are far from human. In isolated cases, echoes of a personality might rise in a flesh golem if the brain used as part of its construction belonged to a particularly powerful personality, but such tragic instances are rare in the extreme.

Suicidal Obedience.name: Suicidal Obedience
Suicidal Obedience.description:
Carvey is unerringly loyal to the Skinsaw cult and to Mobana especially. When Carvey goes berserk, she doesn't attack the nearest living creature or object but instead moves adjacent to the creature nearest the balcony (or similar falling hazard, if the battle is taking place elsewhere) and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} the creature over the cliff's edge.

The number of feet Carvey can Shove a creature is doubled as long as Carvey has 40 or fewer HP (thus, she pushes a creature 10 feet on a sucessful check and 20 feet on a critical success), but she must move the same distance and in the same direction as the pushed creature.

If the shoved creature falls over the cliff's edge, so does Carvey.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description:
A severely damaged flesh golem has a chance of going berserk.

If it has 40 or fewer HP at the start of its turn, the golem must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check or go berserk. A berserk golem wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.

Electric Reflexes.name: Electric Reflexes
Electric Reflexes.description:
Trigger The golem takes electricity damage and a creature is adjacent to it.

Effect The golem lashes out and tries to grab a nearby creature. The golem attempts an Athletics check to [[/act grapple]] an adjacent creature. The creature also takes @Damage[3d6[electricity]] damage on a success, or @Damage[6d6[electricity]] damage on a critical success.

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by fire (@Damage[5d8[untyped]], @Damage[3d4[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by electricity (area @Damage[2d4[healing]] HP); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone.name: Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone
Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone.description: Casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} spell on the flesh golem affects the golem normally.

Berserk Slam.name: Berserk Slam
Berserk Slam.description:
Requirement The flesh golem is berserk.

Effect The flesh golem Strikes with its fist at a -1 circumstance penalty. If it hits, it deals 1d6 extra damage and knocks the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Tiderunner Aquamancer.name: Tiderunner Aquamancer
Tiderunner Aquamancer.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. enchantments, -2 to all saves vs. aboleth effects

equipment-+2 Striking Spear.name: +2 Striking Spear
equipment-+2 Striking Spear.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

Water Shield.name: Water Shield
Water Shield.description: The aquamancer is surrounded by a bubble of water that buffers attacks. Each round, the shield absorbs the first 25 damage that would be dealt to the aquamancer. The shield can absorb only bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, acid, cold, and fire damage types. The aquamancer can dismiss or raise their shield by spending a single action.

Water Elemental Vessel.name: Water Elemental Vessel
Water Elemental Vessel.publicNotes: Spellcasters create elemental vessels by harvesting raw elemental energy and then binding it within a specially enchanted magic circle to grant it life.

Spell Circle.name: Spell Circle
Spell Circle.description: By performing an hour-long ritual, an elemental vessel can form a spell circle with an arcane or primal spellcaster. After the spell circle is formed, other spellcasters can join the spell circle by performing the same hour-long ritual while assisted by at least one spellcaster already in the spell circle. Each member of the spell circle must contribute at least one spell to the elemental vessel. The spellcaster permanently loses access to a spell slot equal to the spell's rank and the elemental vessel adds the contributed spell to its list of arcane innate spells (regardless of the spell's original type). An elemental vessel can be imbued with no more than three spells per spell rank. If the elemental vessel is destroyed, all members of the spell circle regain the spell slots they contributed to the creature. The arcane innate spells shown below represent a typical spell list for an elemental vessel, but each elemental vessel is likely to have different spells depending on what its spell circle has contributed.

Dispel Vulnerability.name: Dispel Vulnerability
Dispel Vulnerability.description: Whenever a creature successfully counteracts one of its spells, the vessel permanently loses access to that spell and takes damage equal to 4 × the spell's rank. The spell circle member who contributed that spell regains access to their contributed spell slot.

Inhabit Vessel.name: Inhabit Vessel
Inhabit Vessel.description: Any member of the elemental vessel's spell circle can spend 3 actions to mentally inhabit the vessel for 1 round. While they inhabit the vessel, the inhabiter controls the vessel's actions, and the vessel uses the inhabiter's Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma modifiers for all checks. Only one creature can inhabit an elemental vessel at a time.

Engulf.name: Engulf
Engulf.description:
@Check[reflex|dc:35] save, no damage, [[/act escape dc=35]], Rupture 28

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Engulf]

Internal Spell Strike.name: Internal Spell Strike
Internal Spell Strike.description: The elemental vessel targets an engulfed creature with one of its spells. The spell must have a range of touch.

Distracting Shadows.name: Distracting Shadows
Distracting Shadows.description: Skebs can use creatures that are at least one size larger than themself as cover for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} actions.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Skebs deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Lusca.name: Lusca
Lusca.publicNotes: A lusca is a predatory sea monster that resembles a three-headed shark with the body of an octopus. Ferocious electrical storms usually herald a lusca's arrival; such violent bursts of electricity result from the creature's superconductive flesh, which allows the lusca to store energy from lightning strikes that it can then discharge at foes.

Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
The lusca gains 2 extra reactions at the start of each of its turns that it can use only to make an Attack of Opportunity with its jaws. It can't use more than one Attack of Opportunity triggered by the same action.

Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Blood Scent.name: Blood Scent
Blood Scent.description: The lusca can smell blood in the water up to 1 mile away.

Storm Bringer.name: Storm Bringer
Storm Bringer.description: When the lusca is near the surface for more than 1 hour, clouds appear and deliver a thunderstorm with a 2-mile radius centered on its location. The weather returns to normal 1 hour after the lusca departs.

Capsize.name: Capsize
Capsize.description: The lusca tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. It must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 35 (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the lusca) or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

Lusca Venom.name: Lusca Venom
Lusca Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 4d6 poison damage and clumsy 1 (1 round)

Stage 2 6d6 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)

Ravenous Jaws.name: Ravenous Jaws
Ravenous Jaws.description: The lusca makes three jaws Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the lusca's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the lusca makes all of these attacks. If the lusca subsequently uses the Grab action, it Grabs any number of creatures it hit with Ravenous Jaws.

equipment-Victor's Medallion from the Ch.name: Victor's Medallion from the Challenge of Sky and Heaven

Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
Flurry of Blows.description:
Shristi makes two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purposes of resistances and weaknesses. He applies his multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

As it has the flourish trait, Shristi can use Flurry of Blows only once per turn.

Heaven's Thunder.name: Heaven's Thunder
Heaven's Thunder.description:
Frequency twice per day

Effect With a loud shout, Shristi unleashes his ki as a crackling shroud of thunder and lightning that engulfs his body. Until the end of his next turn, Shristi's unarmed Strikes and Strikes with weapons that have the monk trait deal an additional 3 electricity damage and 3 sonic damage.

Sky and Heaven Stance.name: Sky and Heaven Stance
Sky and Heaven Stance.description:
Shristi enters a combat stance perfected by past champions of the Challenge of Sky and Heaven. While in this stance, the only Strikes Shristi can make are skyward slash unarmed attacks. These deal 1d10 slashing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the nonlethal, unarmed, and versatile P traits.

While in Sky and Heaven Stance, Shristi gains resistance 2 to electricity and sonic damage.

Pelmo.name: Pelmo
Pelmo.publicNotes:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

Goblin Scuttle.name: Goblin Scuttle
Goblin Scuttle.description:
Trigger A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to Pelmo.

Effect Pelmo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}.

Transparent.name: Transparent
Transparent.description:
A slithering rift is so clear that it's difficult to spot. A successful @Check[perception|dc:48] check is required to notice a stationary slithering rift, and a creature must be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Searching} to attempt this check.

A creature that walks into the rift's space might fall into any pit currently in effect due to Dimensional Pit.

Breach Vulnerability.name: Breach Vulnerability
Breach Vulnerability.description:
Ingesting an extradimensional space like that found in a bag of holding deals @Damage[12d8[force]] damage to the slithering rift and its occupants.

The slithering rift then immediately uses Out You Go.

Dimensional Pit.name: Dimensional Pit
Dimensional Pit.description:
The slithering rift opens an extradimensional, 20-foot-deep pit that covers its own space and all adjacent squares unless they are walls or similarly blocking terrain.

Any other creature occupying spaces in the pit must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:40|traits:damaging-effect] save or fall into the pit, taking damage from the fall (typically @Damage[10[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage). Any creature grabbed by the ooze is released from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.i18TlebMzwONyPhI]{Grab} and falls in, even if it was outside the pit squares.

While the pit is open, the slithering rift is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and can't be forced to move. It can make pseudopod Strikes originating from the walls of the pit. A creature that starts its turn at the bottom of the pit takes @Damage[5d6[acid]] damage.

Creatures can climb the walls with a @Check[athletics|dc:40|name:Climb Out of the Rift|traits:action:climb] check. When the slithering rift dies, the pit closes and creatures inside are ejected, as Out you Go.

Flurry of Pods.name: Flurry of Pods
Flurry of Pods.description:
The slithering rift makes a single pseudopod Strike against each target within range it hasn't already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

These attacks count toward the slithering rift's multiple attack penalty, but this penalty doesn't increase until after all of these attacks.

Out You Go.name: Out You Go
Out You Go.description:
The slithering rift closes all pit spaces it created using Dimensional Pit, ejecting all its occupants onto the ground into random free spaces where the opening of the pit was.

Each occupant takes @Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save).

Cheek Pouches.name: Cheek Pouches
Cheek Pouches.description: A ratfolk has stretchy cheek pouches that can store up to 1 cubic foot of objects. The ratfolk can remove or store an item using the Interact action. As long as the ratfolk has at least one object in its cheek pouches, its speech is noticeably difficult to understand.

Katar Specialist.name: Katar Specialist
Katar Specialist.description: Gref has trained extensively with the katar blade. Any katar he wields gains the finesse trait.

Quick Stow.name: Quick Stow
Quick Stow.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect Gref stores one held item of light or negligible Bulk in his cheek pouches.

Swarming.name: Swarming
Swarming.description:
A ratfolk can end its movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability.

Only two such creatures can share the same space.

Dubious Shifting.name: Dubious Shifting
Dubious Shifting.description:
The zrukbat assumes the shape of any Small object or ornamentation, although the zrukbat's mimicked objects usually have unrealistic or suspicious quirks.

This doesn't change the zrukbat's size but can alter their coloration and visual appearance.

They have an automatic result of 23 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as the mimicked object.

Go for the Eyes.name: Go for the Eyes
Go for the Eyes.description:
The zrukbat flies up to its Speed and makes a claw Strike at the end of its move.

If the claw attack hits, the target must succeed on a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] saving throw or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round (or blinded for 1 minute on a critical failure). If the Strike was a critical hit, the target's save result is one degree of success worse.

equipment-+2 Striking Crossbow.name: +2 Striking Crossbow
equipment-+2 Striking Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

equipment-+2 Striking Dagger.name: +2 Striking Dagger
equipment-+2 Striking Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment-+2 Resilient Studded Leather A.name: +2 Resilient Studded Leather Armor
equipment-+2 Resilient Studded Leather A.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

equipment-Bolts.name: Bolts
equipment-Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

Sidestep.name: Sidestep
Sidestep.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting the assassin fails or critically fails

Effect The assassin deftly steps out of the way of the attack. If there's another creature adjacent to the assassin and within reach of the triggering attack, the assassin redirects the attack to that adjacent creature. The attacker then rerolls the Strike's attack roll against the new target.

Point Blank.name: Point Blank
Point Blank.description: The master assassin makes a crossbow Strike against an adjacent enemy; unlike most ranged Strikes, this Strike doesn't provoke reactions. If successful, the attack deals an additional 4d8 precision damage.

Running Reload.name: Running Reload
Running Reload.description: The master assassin Strides, Steps, or Sneaks, then Interacts to reload her crossbow.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The master assassin deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Study Target.name: Study Target
Study Target.description: The master assassin observes a single target she can see, allowing her to use her Vorpal Garrote during the next round.

Vorpal Garrote.name: Vorpal Garrote
Vorpal Garrote.description:
Requirements The master assassin used Study Target during the previous round and must have a garrote bolt

Effect The master assassin makes a crossbow Strike against the target she previously studied. If she rolls a success on her attack roll, she gets a critical success instead. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:36|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Success No additional effect.

Failure The target takes an additional 3d12 precision damage.

Critical Failure The target is decapitated and instantly dies unless it doesn't require a head to live.

equipment-+1 Studded Leather Armor.name: +1 Studded Leather Armor
equipment-+1 Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

equipment-Alchemist Goggles.name: Alchemist Goggles
equipment-Alchemist Goggles.description:
These brass goggles are engraved with flame patterns and have thick, heavy lenses.

While worn, they give you a +1 item bonus to Crafting checks to Craft alchemical items and a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with alchemical bombs.

You can also ignore lesser cover when making Strikes with alchemical bombs.

equipment-Alchemist's Tools.name: Alchemist's Tools
equipment-Alchemist's Tools.description: This mobile collection of vials and chemicals can be used for simple alchemical tasks.

equipment-Formula Book.name: Formula Book
equipment-Formula Book.description:
A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.

Contains formulas for the following:

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XWkeL34yJK6t5qUE]{Antidote (Greater)}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.oCuwJ9IUDAuzsUwa]{Bravo's Brew (Moderate)}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.c21stU5rhN4F2fZl]{Elixir of Life (Moderate)}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.evBPzM1VsuYcoenn]{Tanglefoot Bag (Moderate)}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.WL4O32qFifxnMj0H]{Wyvern Poison}

Infused Items.name: Infused Items
Infused Items.description: Japu carries the following infused items, which last 24 hours or until the next time he makes his daily preparations: infused moderate acid flasks (2), infused moderate alchemist's fires (2), moderate elixirs of life (2), infused reagents (6), infused moderate tanglefoot bags (2).

Alchemical Formulas (10th).name: Alchemical Formulas (10th)
Alchemical Formulas (10th).description: moderate acid flask, moderate alchemist's fire, greater antidote, moderate bravo's brew, moderate elixir of life, moderate tanglefoot bag, wyvern poison

Expanded Splash.name: Expanded Splash
Expanded Splash.description: Japu's bombs that have the splash trait deal 5 splash damage and splash to 10 feet.

Quick Alchemy.name: Quick Alchemy
Quick Alchemy.description:
Cost 1 batch of infused reagents

Effect Japu creates a single alchemical item from his formula book (see Alchemical Formulas). This item has the infused trait, but it remains potent only until the end of his next turn.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: Japu Interacts to draw a bomb then Strikes with it.

Collapse.name: Collapse
Collapse.description:
Trigger The Iroran skeleton is critically hit

Effect The Iroran skeleton collapses into a pile of bones and the attack deals damage for a hit, rather than a critical hit.

The skeleton can reform in a standing position as an action, but until it does, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.

Flurry of Claws.name: Flurry of Claws
Flurry of Claws.description:
The Iroran skeleton makes two claw Strikes. If both hit the same creature, the damage is combined for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

The multiple attack penalty applies to the Strikes as normal.

Wall Run.name: Wall Run
Wall Run.description: The Iroran skeleton can Stride along vertical surfaces, such as walls, as long as it begins and ends its movement on a horizontal surface.

Water Step.name: Water Step
Water Step.description: The Iroran skeleton can Stride across liquid surfaces. If it ends its movement on a liquid surface, it falls in as normal.

Whirlwind Kick.name: Whirlwind Kick
Whirlwind Kick.description: The Iroran skeleton makes a single Strike and compares the result to the AC of all creatures within its reach, dealing damage to each creature hit.

Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The minchgorm Grabs a creature in its jaws

Effect The minchgorm uses Swallow Whole.

Riptide.name: Riptide
Riptide.description: Tentacles of water rise up and attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} all enemies within 15 feet of the minchgorm. The minchgorm attempts an @Check[athletics] check against the Fortitude DC of each creature in the area. On a success, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} ([[/act escape dc=40]]). On a critical success, or a success against a creature that is already grabbed, the target begins to drown.

Watery Simulacra.name: Watery Simulacra
Watery Simulacra.description: The minchgorm raises up to eight figures from nearby water, each appearing in an empty space within 60 feet of the minchgorm. A simulacrum can take any shape of size Medium or smaller that the minchgorm desires, including that of a specific individual or object, but is always plainly made of water. The minchgorm can speak, cast spells, and use its senses through its simulacra, spending actions for a simulacrum on a one-for-one basis. By using a single action with the concentrate trait, the minchgorm can cause any number of simulacra to Fly, Step, Stride, or Swim up to 60 feet. A simulacrum uses the minchgorm's AC and saving throws and has 30 Hit Points. A minchgorm can have up to eight simulacra in existence at once. Simulacra dissolve immediately when more than 60 feet from the minchgorm, or if the minchgorm dies or falls unconscious. The minchgorm can dismiss any number of its simulacra as a free action.

Ulressia The Blessed.name: Ulressia The Blessed
Ulressia The Blessed.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Crystal Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Crystal Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Crystal Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: Ulressia automatically detects crystals or crystalline items within 30 feet.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Aura of Angry Crystals.name: Aura of Angry Crystals
Aura of Angry Crystals.description:
60 feet. Any creature that ends its turn in the aura while in possession of any crystals, gemstones, or other precious stones must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:39|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is immune to the aura for 1 hour.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature's crystals reverberate with Ulressia's vengeful aura, sharpening at every corner and digging, as if powerfully magnetized, into the creature's flesh.

The creature takes @Damage[4d6[piercing]] damage, plus @Damage[5[void]] damage for every 2,000 gp the crystals are cumulatively worth (maximum 40 damage).

The creature can't discard the crystals until they leave the aura or roll a successful save against it.

Critical Failure As failure, but @Damage[8d6[piercing]] damage, plus @Damage[10[void]] damage for every 2,000 gp of the crystals' value (maximum 80 damage).

Ulressia can deactivate or activate this aura using a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

Crystallize Blood.name: Crystallize Blood
Crystallize Blood.description:
Ulressia channels her warped powers over crystals through her blade and into a creature's body, partially crystallizing its blood.

Ulressia makes a melee dagger Strike. On a hit, the creature takes damage as normal and must also roll a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}, plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Stunning Strike.name: Stunning Strike
Stunning Strike.description:
Requirements Ulressia hit a foe earlier this turn with a weapon Strike

Effect Ulressia makes a weapon Strike against the foe. On a success, the foe must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. On a critical failure, the foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} instead.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of an evil or chaotic creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[6d6[healing]] Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:27]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a zeal-damned ghoul the next midnight.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).name: Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat)
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:22|name:Approach Rune] (trained) to approach without triggering the trap, followed by @Check[thievery|dc:22|name:Erase Summoning Rune|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to erase the rune or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd rank; counteract DC 20) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).hazarddescription: An invisible cloud of magical sensors detects living creatures in the room and summons fire elementals to slay the creatures.
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).reset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

Summon Elementals.name: Summon Elementals
Summon Elementals.description:
Trigger A living creature enters the room

Effect Two rounds after a creature enters the room, the room's door slams shut and locks (two [[/act pick-a-lock dc=20]]{Thievery} checks to pick), and two @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.xN5J9S485LxFZMkL]{Cinder Rat} fire elementals emerge from the floor.

The elementals roll initiative and remain for [[/gmr 3d6 #rounds]]{3d6 rounds}, after which the spell ends and the creatures disappear. The elementals also disappear if someone disables the trap before the duration expires.

The summoned elementals can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.

Izfiitar.name: Izfiitar
Izfiitar.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 120 feet.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 120 feet
Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 120 feet.description:
A Izfiitar can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the izflitar the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The izflitar's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Kiss of the Speakers.name: Kiss of the Speakers
Kiss of the Speakers.description:
The izfiitar continuously tinkers with the myriad possibilities in which it can move or manipulate magic.

The izfiitar is always @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} and can use the extra action only to Cast a Spell, Step, or Stride.

Prescient Revision.name: Prescient Revision
Prescient Revision.description:
Trigger The izfiitar fails a check

Effect The izfiitar rerolls the triggering check and takes the better result.

For [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, it loses the effects of Kiss of the Speakers and can't use Reshape Reality.

Protean Anatomy 25.name: Protean Anatomy 25
Protean Anatomy 25.description:
A izfiitar's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the izfiitar takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The izfiitar is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the izfiitar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The izfiitar takes the appearance of any Huge or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Greater Warpwave Strike.name: Greater Warpwave Strike
Greater Warpwave Strike.description:
Any creature struck and damaged by an izfiitar's jaws or claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save or be subject to a particularly powerful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave}.

Roll twice and apply both affects, rerolling any duplicates.

Reshape Reality.name: Reshape Reality
Reshape Reality.description: When the izfiitar casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage}, it infuses the illusion with quasi-real substance. Creatures that do not disbelieve the illusion treat structures and terrain created through the spell as though they were real, ascending illusory stairs, becoming trapped by illusory quicksand, and so on.

Storm of Claws.name: Storm of Claws
Storm of Claws.description: The izfiitar makes up to six claw Strikes, each against a different target.

Disgorge Portal.name: Disgorge Portal
Disgorge Portal.description:
The camarach vomits a spray of coruscating light. This has the effect of a DC 42 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d6o52BnjViNz7Gub]{Prismatic Spray}, except that each creature is affected by one violet beam and one other beam (roll 1d6 instead of 1d8 to determine which other beam).

The camarach can't Disgorge a Portal again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Disgorge a Portal]]{1d4 rounds}.

Exile.name: Exile
Exile.description:
The camarach shunts one creature within its body through an inner portal to send it away.

The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save.

Critical Success The creature is teleported to an open space it chooses within 30 feet of the camarach.

Success The creature isn't teleported.

Failure The creature is teleported to a random open space 1 mile from the camarach.

Critical Failure The creature is teleported to a random other plane, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Interplanar Teleport}.

Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The camarach Grabs a creature

Effect The camarach uses Swallow Whole.

Project False Image.name: Project False Image
Project False Image.description: When the camarach casts project image, its illusory image can be another creature of its size or a structure of its size that features a large portal (such as a freestanding archway or a large hut with an open doorway).

Overdrive Imentesh.name: Overdrive Imentesh
Overdrive Imentesh.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description:
An overdrive imentesh can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the overdrive imentesh the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The overdrive imentesh's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Protean Anatomy 19.name: Protean Anatomy 19
Protean Anatomy 19.description:
A overdrive imentesh's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly.

Immediately after the hegessik takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The overdrive imentesh is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the overdrive imentesh automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The imentesh takes the appearance of any Large or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but it might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Inflict Warpwave.name: Inflict Warpwave
Inflict Warpwave.description: An imentesh inflicts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave} on a creature within 100 feet (@Check[fortitude|dc:38] to resist).

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: An imentesh's Strikes deal an additional 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Warpwave Strike.name: Warpwave Strike
Warpwave Strike.description: Any creature struck and damaged by an imentesh's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save or be subject to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave}.

Agradaemon.name: Agradaemon
Agradaemon.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair an agradaemon's vision; it ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Choking Smog.name: Choking Smog
Choking Smog.description: 100 feet. The agradaemon is surrounded by ashy smoke. Creatures within the aura are concealed, and creatures outside of it are concealed to creatures within it. Non-daemon creatures can't breathe in the aura and must hold their breath or suffocate.

Daemonic Pledge.name: Daemonic Pledge
Daemonic Pledge.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The agradaemon designates a single willing mortal as a pledged fanatic. That creature gains resistance to fire equal to its level, immunity to the agradaemon's choking smog aura, and smoke vision.

The agradaemon can have up to 10 pledged fanatics at one time and can remove the status from any number of pledged fanatics as a free action with the concentrate trait. The status can also be removed with an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Fd4lxozd11MQ55N]{Atone} ritual.

Proven Devotion.name: Proven Devotion
Proven Devotion.description:
The agradaemon regains @Damage[15[untyped]] Hit Points, and a pledged fanatic of the agradaemon's choice that it can see loses 15 Hit Points (no effects apply that would decrease this Hit Point loss).

A pledged creature that dies in this way explodes and deals @Damage[9d10[fire]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[emanation|distance:20] (@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Rage.name: Rage
Rage.description:
Requirements Bolar isn't fatigued or raging

Effect Bolar gains 3 temporary Hit Points that last until the rage ends. While raging, he deals 2 additional damage with melee attacks and takes a -1 penalty to AC. The rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies Bolar can perceive, or until Bolar falls unconscious.

Once the rage ends, Bolar can't Rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.name: Kharnas's Lesser Glyph
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.disable: Disable @Check[thievery|dc:46|name:Destroy Glyph|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to destroy the glyph, @Check[arcana|dc:42|name:Divert Glyph's Power] (master) to harmlessly divert the glyph's power, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th rank; counteract DC 38) to counteract the glyph
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.hazarddescription: A hidden glyph suddenly lights up and dominates the mind of any creature not bearing the sigil of Kharnas the Angel-Binder.
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.reset: The glyph can affect two creatures before it deactivates for 5 minutes and automatically resets.

Dominate.name: Dominate
Dominate.description:
Trigger A creature who doesn't bear the sigil of Kharnas attempts to open the door

Effect A surge of the Radiant Spark's latent power courses through the glyph and washes over the triggering creature. If the creature is undead, it takes @Damage[10d10[vitality]] damage. If it's living, it instead regains @Damage[10d10[healing]] Hit Points. It then must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:40|traits:incapacitation,mental] save or be affected by a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} spell.

The spell commands the affected creature to attack the nearest creature who doesn't bear the sigil of Kharnas.

equipment-Crossbow.name: Crossbow
equipment-Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

equipment-+2 Greater Striking Longsword.name: +2 Greater Striking Longsword
equipment-+2 Greater Striking Longsword.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

equipment-Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
equipment-Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

equipment-Disguise Kit (Elite).name: Disguise Kit (Elite)
equipment-Disguise Kit (Elite).description: This small wooden box contains cosmetics, false facial hair, spirit gum, and a few simple wigs. You usually need a disguise kit to set up a disguise in order to Impersonate someone using the Deception skill. An elite disguise kit adds a +1 item bonus to relevant checks. If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.

equipment-Bolts.name: Bolts
equipment-Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

Dueling Parry.name: Dueling Parry
Dueling Parry.description: As long as he has one free hand, Grimwold can parry attacks against him with his longsword. He gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of his next turn as long as his other hand remains free.

Studied Strike.name: Studied Strike
Studied Strike.description: Grimwold studies his foe for weaknesses to exploit. His next successful Strike against that target deals an additional 4d6 precision damage.

Needling Stairs.name: Needling Stairs
Needling Stairs.hp: to break the spring under the step and make that step safe to stand on
Needling Stairs.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:33|name:Disable Stair Spring|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on each stair to disable its spring, or deactivate the switch in area C8 to deactivate the whole trap. Cutting the wire on the topmost stair (>@Check[thievery|dc:35|name:Cut Wire on Top-Most Stair|traits:action:disable-a-device] to Disable the Device) that connects the staircase to the control switch prevents the control switch from turning the trap on or off.
Needling Stairs.hazarddescription: This staircase has springs in each step, which send poisoned needles shooting up through tiny holes in the wood when stepped on. Each step, 6 in total, takes up one 5-foot square.
Needling Stairs.routine: (1 action) The trap makes a separate poisoned needle Strike against each creature currently on an active step as 1 action. Because it is constantly jabbing needles up through any weight-bearing steps, the trap can also use its Bloody Feet free action to jab at a creature on one of the steps during that creature's turn.
Needling Stairs.reset: If deactivated via the switch, the trap can be reactivated with the switch in area C8.

First Step.name: First Step
First Step.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement on one of the stairs

Effect The trap makes a poisoned needle Strike against the triggering creature, then rolls initiative.

Bloody Feet.name: Bloody Feet
Bloody Feet.description:
Trigger A creature moves onto an active step

Effect The trap makes a poisoned needle Strike against the triggering creature.

No MAP.name: No MAP
No MAP.description: The Poisoned Needle Strikes do not apply a MAP.

Iron Maiden Trap.name: Iron Maiden Trap
Iron Maiden Trap.hp: Iron Maiden Hardness 12; Iron Maiden HP 46 (BT 23)
Iron Maiden Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] to disable the pressure plate
Iron Maiden Trap.hazarddescription: A pressure plate hidden on the floor before an iron maiden causes the torture device to snap shut and trap the triggering creature inside.
Iron Maiden Trap.reset: The pressure plate must be reset manually.

Slam Shut.name: Slam Shut
Slam Shut.description:
Trigger A creature steps onto the trap's pressure plate (indicated on the map)

Effect The front of the iron maiden slams shut with incredible force and locks itself. The triggering creature takes @Damage[(4d10+10)[piercing],2d6[bleed]]{4d10+10 piercing damage and 2d6 persistent bleed damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:inflicts:immobilized] save; if the creature critically succeeds, they avoid the trap completely). The triggering creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. The victim can end their immobilization only once a creature outside the iron maiden unlocks the device (requiring two successful DC 28 Thievery checks to [[/act disable-device dc=28]]) or breaks the iron maiden, after which the trapped creature must succeed at a DC 25 check to [[/act escape dc=25]] the trap's spike-lined interior.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/gmr 1d10 #days]] days-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

Sacrilegious Aura.name: Sacrilegious Aura
