Sacrilegious Aura.description: 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a vitality spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a +27 counteract modifier.

Devastating Blast.name: Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description:
The graveknight unleashes a @Template[cone|distance:30] of energy.

Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d12[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The graveknight can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.

Graveknight's Curse.name: Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:43|traits:curse] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, hampered 10, and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight

Kharnas's Blessing.name: Kharnas's Blessing
Kharnas's Blessing.description:
The graveknight carves the sigil of Kharnas onto an adjacent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature.

As long as the creature bears the sigil of Kharnas, it takes a -2 status penalty to saving throws against the abilities of any creature that previously served Kharnas, but it can also freely pass through any hazards that can be bypassed by those bearing the sigil of Kharnas, such as Kharnas's glyphs.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.St2QzqQvKN0IaXxG]{Effect: Kharna's Blessing}

Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
Weapon Master.description: The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.

Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
Motion Sense 60 feet.description: Tyrroicese can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

Pseudopod Burst.name: Pseudopod Burst
Pseudopod Burst.description:
Tyrroicese makes up to three pseudopod strikes, each against a different creature.

Tyrroicese's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all these attacks are made.

Rallying Call.name: Rallying Call
Rallying Call.description:
When Tyrroicese subsumed Corporal Quordein, it gained a perverted form of the commander's ability to rally allies.

The first time Tyrroicese uses this ability, it summons an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.uQBOJfjtzEXvpLQz]{Ochre Jelly}, which leaks out of the ceiling of area D13 and drops to the floor to join the fight, siding with Tyrroicese.

Thereafter, when Tyrroicese uses this ability, any oozes within 60 feet become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round (the oozes can use their extra action only to Stride) and, if they're not allied with the agents, the oozes ally themselves with Tyrroicese.

Stretching Step.name: Stretching Step
Stretching Step.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Tyrroicese forcefully extends a sticky pseudopod, plants it on a wall within 45 feet, and retracts the muscle.

Tyrroicese springs over to a space adjacent to the wall, moving through the intervening squares as normal but ignoring any difficult or greater difficult terrain.

Subsume.name: Subsume
Subsume.description:
Tyrroicese lifts an adjacent dying creature with its pseudopods and subsumes that creature into its own oozy flesh. The subsumed creature's dying value does not increase, though it can't decrease either.

Tyrroicese regains @Damage[30[healing]] HP and also gains the ability to use one or two of the subsumed creature's special abilities or feats, subject to the GM's discretion.

A creature adjacent to Tyrroicese can extract a subsumed creature by spending 2 actions to attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:29|name:Extract Subsumed Creature] check.

On a success, the subsumed creature is pulled from Tyrroicese and falls into the nearest available space.

Hidden Paragon.name: Hidden Paragon
Hidden Paragon.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger Olansa successfully uses Stealth to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} and become hidden from all of her current foes, or she uses Stealth to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} and become undetected to all her current foes

Effect Olansa becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} for 1 minute, even if she uses a hostile action. Not even @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]{See the Unseen}, or similar effects can reveal her, though creatures can still use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to locate her.

Opportune Backstab.name: Opportune Backstab
Opportune Backstab.description:
Trigger A creature within Olansa's melee reach is hit by a melee attack from one of her allies

Effect Olansa Strikes the triggering creature.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Olansa's true form is that of a monstrous spiderlike daemon. Olansa can still take on her former human appearance. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage modifiers with her Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Olansa deals 4d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature targets Fayati with an attack and she can see the attacker

Effect Fayati dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Opportune Backstab.name: Opportune Backstab
Opportune Backstab.description:
Trigger A creature within Fayati's reach is hit by a melee Strike from one of her allies

Effect Fayati makes a Strike against the triggering creature.

Deepen the Wound.name: Deepen the Wound
Deepen the Wound.description:
Requirements Fayati's last attack was a successful melee Strike with her rapier

Effect Fayati makes a main-gauche Strike against the same creature that she just hit. This Strike deals an additional 4d6 precision damage.

Guildmaster's Lead.name: Guildmaster's Lead
Guildmaster's Lead.description:
Whenever Fayati critically succeeds at a Strike against a creature, until the start of her next turn, the first time that another member of the Copper Hand deals damage to that creature during their turn, they deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dVVc5MYx4G3QPHoa]{Effect: Guildmaster's Lead}

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Fayati deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

equipment-+1 Striking Crossbow.name: +1 Striking Crossbow
equipment-+1 Striking Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

equipment-Thunderstone (Greater).name: Thunderstone (Greater)
equipment-Thunderstone (Greater).description:
When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be deafened until the end of its next turn. Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 3d4 sonic damage and 3 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 28.

equipment-+1 Striking Longsword.name: +1 Striking Longsword
equipment-+1 Striking Longsword.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

equipment-Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
equipment-Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

equipment-Bolts.name: Bolts
equipment-Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

Binding Blast.name: Binding Blast
Binding Blast.description: A commando's thunderstone is infused with special reagents to produce a blinding flash of light. In addition to the thunderstone's normal effects, creatures that fail the saving throw against the thunderstone are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round. Creatures that critically fail are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round. Creatures who protect their eyes, such as by wearing tinted goggles, are immune to the infused thunderstone's blinding effect.

Target Culprit.name: Target Culprit
Target Culprit.description: The commando designates a single creature as their culprit. The commando gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} their culprit and a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} their culprit. The commando's attacks deal an additional 2d8 precision damage to the culprit. This designation lasts for 24 hours or until the commando targets another creature with this ability.

Alchemical Reaction.name: Alchemical Reaction
Alchemical Reaction.description:
Trigger The alchemical horror takes damage from an alchemical bomb

Effect The volatile substances that compose the alchemical horror froth outward as they react with the bomb. The bomb's full effects affect creatures in every space within 15 feet of the alchemical horror, and splash damage affects creatures 5 feet beyond that.

Alchemical Torrent.name: Alchemical Torrent
Alchemical Torrent.description:
The alchemical horror spews a torrent of alchemical fluids in a @Template[cone|distance:30] that deals @Damage[20d6[acid]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The alchemical horror can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Alchemical Torrent]]{1d4 rounds}.

Planar Coven.name: Planar Coven
Planar Coven.description: As long as at least one other member of Myrna's coven is on the demiplane of Stormholt, the coven members add chain lightning, lightning bolt, plane shift, and punishing winds to their spells, each of which can be cast at up to 8th level.

Sea Hag's Bargain.name: Sea Hag's Bargain
Sea Hag's Bargain.description: The sea hag can make a bargain with a willing creature, who must be of sound mind. The creature gives away a special or cherished quality-such as its courage, its beauty, or its voice-in exchange for a boon or a promise from the sea hag. As long as the sea hag keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore the lost quality is to defeat the sea hag or make another bargain for its return.

Dread Gaze.name: Dread Gaze
Dread Gaze.description:
The hag gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with intense distress and a gnawing sense of impending doom, with a result depending on its @Check[will|dc:37] save. The target does not need to be able to see the sea hag.

Critical Success No effect.

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure Frightened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round. If the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}, it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

Critical Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and slowed 1 for 1 minute. If the target was dying, it remains unconscious for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

Pull Under.name: Pull Under
Pull Under.description:
Requirements A creature within 60 feet of Graem or Grinlowe is in contact with the waters of Stormholt

Effect The hag casts maze (DC 37) on the creature, magically pulling the creature beneath the water (regardless of its actual depth) into an extradimensional underwater maze of shipwrecks. Between the two of them, Graem and Grinlowe can have only one creature trapped in the maze, but either hag can use the Sustain a Spell action to sustain the effect.

Nenchuuj.name: Nenchuuj
Nenchuuj.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Distort Magic.name: Distort Magic
Distort Magic.description:
Trigger A creature targets the nenchuuj with a spell

Effect The nenchuuj warps the creature's magic, attempting an Arcana check to counteract the spell. If successful, the nenchuuj can instead redirect the spell, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OOELvfkTedBMlWtq]{Spell Turning}, onto the caster or onto a different target within range from the caster.

Easy to Call.name: Easy to Call
Easy to Call.description: The sahkil is considered 2 levels lower for the purposes of being summoned by rituals (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle}), but is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

Skip Between.name: Skip Between
Skip Between.description: The sahkil can move itself between the Ethereal Plane and the Material Plane, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt}, except that this ability has an unlimited duration and can be Dismissed.

Tainted Backlash.name: Tainted Backlash
Tainted Backlash.description:
A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} by the sahkil's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O6VQC1Bs4aSYDa6R]{Mask of Terror} is gripped with fear of the ways magic can go wrong.

The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for as long as it is frightened. If the creature Casts a Spell during its turn, it can't reduce its frightened condition at the end of that turn.

Toxin-Inured.name: Toxin-Inured
Toxin-Inured.description: A poison eater can't gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition from poisons.

Consume Poison.name: Consume Poison
Consume Poison.description:
The poison eater uses an Interact action to draw a dose of poison and eats it, gaining strength.

The poison-eater's Strikes deal two weapon dice of damage rather than one. The poison eater is affected by the consumed poison normally and, therefore, usually chooses poisons mitigated by their poison resistance and toxin-inured ability.

At the end of each of their turns, the poison eater attempts a @Check[flat|dc:17|name:Consumed Poison Metabolizes] check; on a success, this ability ends.

Poison Frenzy.name: Poison Frenzy
Poison Frenzy.description:
Requirements The poison eater isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger the poison eater damages a creature while Consume Poison is in effect

Effect The poison eater flies into a frenzy that lasts for 1 minute. While in a frenzy, the poison eater gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with melee Strikes, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with melee Strikes, gains 20 temporary Hit Points until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The poison eater can't voluntarily end their frenzy. After their frenzy, the poison eater is fatigued.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.u2z1BgpZsxl7Zc2z]{Effect: Poison Frenzy}

Vein Walker.name: Vein Walker
Vein Walker.description: The excorion moves about by way of hundreds of pulsating blood vessels, which stretch from its body in dozens of tight, ropy bundles and anchor it to the ground. An excorion cannot be Tripped, Shoved, or otherwise forcibly moved except by magic, and the excorion ignores difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain).

Bloody Handprint.name: Bloody Handprint
Bloody Handprint.description: The excorion plants a magical handprint on the target, marking them as chosen for death. The excorion makes a fist Strike against an adjacent creature; this does not count toward the excorion's multiple attack penalty. On a hit, the attack does no damage, but the creature becomes observed to every excorion within 60 feet, even if an excorion's line of sight would be blocked by a wall or other obstacle. This effect lasts until the handprint is washed off, which requires water and spending 3 actions to fully clean off.

Vital Transfusion.name: Vital Transfusion
Vital Transfusion.description:
Requirements The excorion has at least 70 Hit Points

Effect The excorion sacrifices itself and transfers its bloody, vital energy to a willing living creature within 30 feet. The excorion is immediately destroyed, and the targeted living creature heals a number of HP equal to half the excorion's remaining HP at the time that it used this ability.

The living creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} during its next turn as its body adjusts to the newly transfused blood and vital energy; the living creature also counts as an excorion for 1 minute for the purpose of seeing other excorions' Bloody Handprint marks.

Vomit Blood.name: Vomit Blood
Vomit Blood.description: The excorion spews necrotic blood all over a foe it has grabbed. The grabbed creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Miogimo.name: Miogimo
Miogimo.allSaves: +1 status bonus to Will saves vs. mental effects

Little Favors.name: Little Favors
Little Favors.description: Each time a creature willingly performs a service, quest, or task for the zealborn, the creature takes a cumulative -1 status penalty to saving throws against the zealborn's mental spells and abilities (maximum -4).

+1 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental.name: +1 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When Miogimo is destroyed, he re-forms, fully healed, near a follower of his choice in [[/gmr 1d10 #Rejuvenation]]{1d10 days}. For the purposes of rejuvenation, a follower is defined as an intelligent creature who's well acquainted with Miogimo and is a true believer in Miogimo's mission, not merely a lukewarm supporter. Miogimo can be permanently destroyed only if he has no current followers or can be convinced to end his own life.

Trickster's Ace.name: Trickster's Ace
Trickster's Ace.description:
Trigger An effect would cause Miogimo to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} or would slow his movement

Effect Miogimo casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Unfettered Movement} on himself.

Zealous Restoration.name: Zealous Restoration
Zealous Restoration.description: Miogimo can't regain Hit Points through resting or void healing; he feeds only on the idealism of his supporters, regaining 10 Hit Points per day for each creature under the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q690d3mw3TUrKX7E]{Geas} cast by Miogimo. Creatures under Miogimo's geas have their maximum HP reduced by 10 each day until they are burned away to a husk and perish. After 24 hours, such creatures rise as zeal-damned ghouls under Miogimo's control. Zeal-damned ghouls eat only the flesh of evil or chaotic creatures and deal an additional 1d6 spirit and 1d6 void damage with their attacks.

Illusory Copies.name: Illusory Copies
Illusory Copies.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Blune calls into existence [[/r 1d4+2 #illusory copies]] illusory copies of himself, which dance around him and copy his every movement, making it almost impossible to pinpoint the true Blune.

Any attack that would hit Blune has a random chance of hitting an illusory copy instead. This effect lasts for up to 1 minute or until all the copies are destroyed or Blune is incapacitated.

Once a copy is hit, it's destroyed. If an attack roll fails to hit Blune's AC but doesn't critically fail, it destroys a copy but has no additional effect (even if the attack would normally have an effect on a failure). If an attack roll is a critical success and would hit a copy, the copy is destroyed and the attack roll becomes a success against Blune.

Once all the copies are destroyed, this ability ends.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Blune deals an additional 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

equipment-Key to the Skinsaw Sanctum Vau.name: Key to the Skinsaw Sanctum Vault

Bloody Sneak Attack.name: Bloody Sneak Attack
Bloody Sneak Attack.description: Any creature taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the Skinner's attacks. When attacking an off-guard creature, the Skinner deals an additional 2d6 precision damage.

Chain Expert.name: Chain Expert
Chain Expert.description: The Skinner can effectively wield abnormally long spiked chains and can do so using only one hand.

Chain Up.name: Chain Up
Chain Up.description:
Requirements The Skinner has an adjacent creature grabbed with her spiked chain

Effect The Skinner attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:reflex] check against the grabbed creature's Reflex save DC. On a success, the Skinner knots her chain around the grabbed creature, which becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} (Escape DC = 10 + the result of the Skinner's Athletics check); on a critical success, the creature also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Regardless of whether the Skinner succeeds, she drops the chain.

Flay.name: Flay
Flay.description: Whenever the Skinner makes a successful cleaver Strike against a grabbed creature, she also deals @Damage[1d6[bleed]] (or @Damage[2d6[bleed]] on a critical hit).

Hook and Flay.name: Hook and Flay
Hook and Flay.description:
Requirements The Skinner has a creature grabbed with her spiked chain

Effect The Skinner pulls the creature into the nearest open adjacent square and makes a cleaver Strike against the creature.

Hands Of The Forgotten.name: Hands Of The Forgotten
Hands Of The Forgotten.disable: @Check[religion|dc:30|name:Exorcise Spirits] (master) to exorcise the spirits or @Check[intimidation|dc:32|name:Scare Away the Hands|traits:action:demoralize] (expert) to scare away the hands
Hands Of The Forgotten.hazarddescription: Ethereal hands stretch out from the walls and floor, attempting to restrain nearby creatures.

Waylay.name: Waylay
Waylay.description:
Trigger A creature moves into the area marked on the map

Effect Misty blue hands stretch out from the hallway's stone tiles and grasp at the triggering creature, which must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:26|traits:damaging-effect] save to avoid becoming hindered or harmed by the ethereal hands.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round and takes @Damage[(2d10+10)[void]] damage.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round and takes @Damage[(4d10+15)[void]] damage.

Maurrisa Jonne.name: Maurrisa Jonne
Maurrisa Jonne.allSaves: +1 status bonus to saves vs. incapacitation effects, +2 status bonus to saves vs. Shove and Trip

+1 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Incapacitat.name: +1 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Incapacitation Effects

+2 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Shove.name: +2 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Shove

+2 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Trip.name: +2 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Trip

Duck and Weave.name: Duck and Weave
Duck and Weave.description:
Trigger A creature misses two consecutive melee Strikes against Maurrisa

Effect Maurrisa takes advantage of a flailing foe's opening. She can either Step 5 feet or make a melee Strike against the triggering creature.

Rabbit Punch.name: Rabbit Punch
Rabbit Punch.description:
Trigger Maurrisa can make an Attack of Opportunity

Effect Maurrisa chops her opponent on the back of the head or neck, possibly concussing them.

The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save. On a failure, the creature takes damage as if hit by Maurrisa's fist Strike, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} instead.

Concussive Beatdown.name: Concussive Beatdown
Concussive Beatdown.description:
Requirements Berleth has just used his shovel to Trip a creature

Effect Berleth brutally brings his shovel down on the prone foe, making a shovel Strike. On a hit, the Strike deals damage as normal, plus the target must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute.

Decapitate.name: Decapitate
Decapitate.description:
Berleth plunges his shovel through a creature's neck as though it were peat moss.

He makes a shovel Strike against an adjacent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} creature. On a hit, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 2} (possibly @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}).

Final Blow.name: Final Blow
Final Blow.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Berleth is reduced to 0 HP

Effect Berleth makes a final shovel Strike before dying.

Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
Motion Sense 60 feet.description: A vaultbreaker ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

Treasure Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Treasure Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Treasure Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: The vaultbreaker ooze's metallic plasm alerts it to the presence of metals with the precious trait (including gold and platinum) within 30 feet.

Metallify.name: Metallify
Metallify.description:
Trigger A creature Strikes the vaultbreaker ooze

Effect The ooze's outer plasm hardens into a protective shell of precious metals. Until the start of its next turn, it gains resistance 5 to physical damage (except adamantine), it has a –5-foot penalty to its Speed, and its pseudopod Strikes gain the versatile S or P weapon trait.

Engulf.name: Engulf
Engulf.description:
@Check[reflex|dc:23|traits:damaging-effect], @Damage[(2d8+9)[acid]] damage, [[/act escape dc=23]], Rupture 14 (19 when using Metallify)

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Engulf]

Form Tool.name: Form Tool
Form Tool.description: The vaultbreaker ooze instinctually shapes its pseudopod into a key, lockpick, or tool required to bypass a locking mechanism; it uses this pseudopod as thieves' tools to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick a Lock} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device}.

The Inkmaster.name: The Inkmaster
The Inkmaster.publicNotes:
Shemhazians rise from the souls of torturers and those who reveled in mutilating the physical bodies of their victims. Standing 35 feet tall, a shemhazian is well equipped with a wide range of talons, claws, and fangs to continue inflicting such torments on those it encounters.

Shemhazians delight in visiting torment upon mortals, of course, but more than most demons, these fiends revel in sharing the pain with their own kind. Other demons fear and hate shemhazians for this reason, with only the most powerful willing to work with a shemhazian to achieve a shared goal. Even then, the shemhazian is always on the watch for an opportunity to bring pain and suffering to its allies along with any foe.
The Inkmaster.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Clockwork Brain.name: Clockwork Brain
Clockwork Brain.description: A second brain, made of clockwork, is implanted in the Inkmaster's skull. Any time he makes a Will save, he rolls twice and takes the higher result.

Paralyzing Gaze.name: Paralyzing Gaze
Paralyzing Gaze.description: 30 feet. A non-evil creature that ends its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save. If it fails, it's slowed 1 for 1 round, and if it critically fails, it is instead paralyzed for 1 round.

Succor Vulnerability.name: Succor Vulnerability
Succor Vulnerability.description: A shemhazian's mutilation is a part of them, and they can't bear to see it reversed. The first time each round that a creature heals from damage the shemhazian dealt on their last turn, the demon takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

Tail Whip.name: Tail Whip
Tail Whip.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the shemhazian's tail leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The shemhazian attempts to Trip the triggering creature. On a success, the creature also takes damage as if the shemhazian had hit with a tail Strike, and if the creature was flying, it falls 30 feet.

Enfeebling Bite.name: Enfeebling Bite
Enfeebling Bite.description: If the shemhazian's jaws Strike damages a creature, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}. The target can attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save to reduce this to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (or be unaffected on a critical success).

Focused Gaze.name: Focused Gaze
Focused Gaze.description: The shemhazian focuses their gaze on a non-evil creature they can see within 30 feet. If that creature isn't already slowed by the shemhazian's paralyzing gaze, it must attempt a save against the shemhazian's paralyzing gaze. If that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round. A shemhazian can't use this ability against the same creature more than once per round.

False Door Trap.name: False Door Trap
False Door Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:32|name:Jam Needle in Housing|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to jam the needle in its housing or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (6th rank, counteract DC 30) to dispel the magical poison.
False Door Trap.hazarddescription: A hidden needle delivers a magical poison to anyone trying to open the door.

Purple Worm Sting.name: Purple Worm Sting
Purple Worm Sting.description:
Trigger A creature touches the door

Effect The creature is targeted by purple worm sting (@Check[fortitude|dc:32] save).

equipment-Purple Worm Venom.name: Purple Worm Venom
equipment-Purple Worm Venom.description:
Venom from enormous purple worms leaves a victim weakened.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw DC 32 Fortitude

n

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

n

Stage 1 @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

n

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Purple Worm Venom.name: Purple Worm Venom
Purple Worm Venom.description:
Venom from enormous purple worms leaves a victim weakened.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32|traits:alchemical,injury,poison]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Kiss.name: Kiss
Kiss.description: The vargouille kisses an adjacent creature that's asleep, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, exposing it to the vargouille transformation disease.

Shriek.name: Shriek
Shriek.description:
The vargouille shrieks, its scream so terrible that all non-vargouilles within 60 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 3 rounds.

The effect ends early for a creature if the vargouille moves out of sight, moves farther than 60 feet from the creature, or attacks the creature with its fangs.

After attempting its save, a creature is immune to that particular vargouille's Shriek for 24 hours.

Vargouille Transformation.name: Vargouille Transformation
Vargouille Transformation.description:
Exposing the victim to sunlight or any light spell of 3rd level or higher pauses the progression of the disease until the victim is no longer in light.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no effect ([[/gmr 1d6 #hours]] hours)

Stage 2 victim's hair falls out ([[/gmr 1d6 #hours]] hours)

Stage 3 victim's ears grow into leathery wings, tentacles sprout on the chin and scalp, and the teeth become long, pointed fangs (1 day)

Stage 4 victim's mind regresses to a vicious and unintelligent shell of its former self ([[/gmr 1d6 #hours]] hours)

Stage 5 victim's head breaks free of the body (which dies) and becomes a new vargouille

Vargouille Venom.name: Vargouille Venom
Vargouille Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18|name:Vargouile Venom]

Stage 1 Damage the victim has taken from vargouille fangs can't be healed magically.

Once all vargouille fang damage has been healed nonmagically, the poison ends.

Joro Spider Venom.name: Joro Spider Venom
Joro Spider Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d8[poison]] (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d8[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d8[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d8[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} ([[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds})

Web Trap.name: Web Trap
Web Trap.description: A creature hit by the joro spider's web Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it [[/act escape dc=25]]{Escapes}.

Boiling Tub Trap.name: Boiling Tub Trap
Boiling Tub Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:32|name:Remove Trip Wire|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to safely remove the trip wire from the bomb
Boiling Tub Trap.hazarddescription: A snapped trip wire causes an alchemical bomb to detonate and blow up part of the tin tub, spilling boiling water all over the trap's victim.

Overflowing Boiling Water.name: Overflowing Boiling Water
Overflowing Boiling Water.description:
Trigger The trip wire is pulled or severed

Effect An acid flask detonates, spraying acid at nearby creatures and causing the tub of boiling water to burst in the same direction.

All creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:5] east of the triggered boiling tub trap take @Damage[3d6[persistent,acid],(3[splash])[acid],(8d6+20)[fire]]{3d6 persistent acid damage, 3 acid splash damage, and 8d6+20 fire damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:31|basic|traits:acid,fire] save).

Flying Guillotine.name: Flying Guillotine
Flying Guillotine.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Erase Glyph|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to erase the glyph (which requires a successful unarmed attack roll if the blade is already active) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd rank; counteract DC 20) to counteract it. The trap has a secret bypass known only to Ralso and Pratchett: as long as the guillotine can see a creature in the room touching thumb and pinky together with an empty hand, it remains dormant.
Flying Guillotine.hazarddescription: An invisible magical glyph on the guillotine's blade detects living creatures in the room, which causes the guillotine to fly off its hinges and attack.
Flying Guillotine.routine: (1 action) The blade @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Flies} up to 20 feet and Strikes any creatures whose squares it passes through. It cannot target the same creature more than once per round. The blade cannot be grappled and doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Flying Guillotine.reset: After 1 minute, the trap deactivates, though the door remains locked. The trap rearms itself each day at dawn.

Flying Blade.name: Flying Blade
Flying Blade.description:
Trigger A living creature enters the room

Effect One round after a creature enters the room, the door to the room slams shut and locks (two [[/act pick-a-lock dc=20]]{Thievery} checks to pick), and the guillotine blade detaches from its housing and begins flying around the room as the trap rolls initiative.

equipment-Cloak of the Bat (Greater).name: Cloak of the Bat (Greater)
equipment-Cloak of the Bat (Greater).description:
Sewn from several long strips of luxurious brown and black silk, this cloak grants you a +3 item bonus to Stealth checks as well as to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight. You can also use your feet to hang from any surface that can support your weight, without requiring any check, though you still must attempt Athletics checks to Climb in order to move around while inverted.

Activate 2 command, Interact

Frequency any number of times per day

Effect You can either transform the cloak into bat-like wings that grant you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes, or have the cloak turn you into a bat by casting a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl]{Pest Form} spell on you.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.ioGzmVSmMGXWWBYb]{Effect: Cloak of the Bat}

equipment-Heartstone.name: Heartstone
equipment-Heartstone.description:
This gemstone grants its wearer a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

Each heartstone is powered by the spirit of a specific night hag. If it's separated from her for 24 hours (or she's been dead for 24 hours), it becomes a nonmagical gemstone. A heartstone allows the hag to use additional occult innate spells: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt} (9th level) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul} at will, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IqJ9URobmJ9L9UBG]{Shadow Blast} twice per day.

Activate A command

Requirements You must be touching the heartstone.

Effect The heartstone attempts to counteract one disease affecting you (counteract rank 5, counteract modifier +18).

Craft Requirements You must be a night hag.

Nightmare Rider.name: Nightmare Rider
Nightmare Rider.description: When a night hag rides a nightmare, the nightmare also gains the night hag's status bonus to saves against magic, and both the hag and rider benefit when the night hag uses her heartstone's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt} innate spell.

Planar Coven.name: Planar Coven
Planar Coven.description: As long as at least one other member of Myrna's coven is on the demiplane of Stormholt, the coven members add chain lightning, lightning bolt, plane shift, and punishing winds to their spells, each of which can be cast at up to 8th level.

Abyssal Plague.name: Abyssal Plague
Abyssal Plague.description:
A creature can't recover from drained until Abyssal plague is cured

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:41]

Stage 1 drained 1 (1 day)

Stage 2 drained 3 (1 day)

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The night hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Dream Haunting.name: Dream Haunting
Dream Haunting.description: If a night hag is ethereal and hovering over a sleeping chaotic or evil creature, she can ride the victim's back until dawn. The creature endures tormenting dreams as the hag casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} on it, and is exposed to abyssal plague. Any drained caused by dream haunting is cumulative. Only an ethereal being can confront the night hag and stop her dream haunting.

Spell Ambush.name: Spell Ambush
Spell Ambush.description: A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the night hag takes a -2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to defend against her spells.

Hundun Chaos Mage.name: Hundun Chaos Mage
Hundun Chaos Mage.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Motion Sense 100 feet.name: Motion Sense 100 feet
Motion Sense 100 feet.description: A hundun chaos mage can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Entropic Feedback.name: Entropic Feedback
Entropic Feedback.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to target the hundun with a mental effect

Effect The triggering creature is subject to the utter chaos of the hundun's mind and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

Activate Attractor.name: Activate Attractor
Activate Attractor.description:
The hundun releases its staff-like attractor, which hovers in place. The hundun can use an action, which has the concentrate trait, to move the attractor up to 60 feet, to a maximum of 300 feet from the hundun. It can also use an action, which has the concentrate trait, to recall the attractor, which flies to the hundun and immediately deactivates.

Creatures within 40 feet of the attractor must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40|name:Attractor] save if they're within the area when the attractor is activated or as soon as they enter the area while it's active. Once a creature has attempted the save, it uses the same result for the rest of that activation of the attractor.

Any restrictions on a creature's movement apply only if it voluntarily moves away from the attractor. For example, if the attractor moves closer to a creature, the creature doesn't then need to move away.

Chaotic creatures are immune to the effects of the attractor.

The attractor can't be harmed by physical attacks but is destroyed by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ihbRf964JDXztcy3]{Disjunction}, a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.HuGZspUvJqR09Y8u]{Rod of Cancellation}, a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.B4DnQNcGl6nFVKHl]{Sphere of Annihilation}, and other similarly powerful effects.

The attractor has an AC of 40 and a counteract DC of 37. A hundun can rebuild a destroyed attractor after [[/gmr 1d8 #hours]]{1d8 hours} of uninterrupted meditation. If the hundun is slain, its attractor disappears.

Critical Success The creature's movement isn't restricted.

Success The creature treats each square in the area as difficult terrain when moving away from the attractor.

Failure The creature can't move away from the attractor within the area.

Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
Flurry of Blows.description: The hundun makes two Strikes with its fist. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Integrated Launcher.name: Integrated Launcher
Integrated Launcher.description: A projectile launcher is integrated into a clockwork assassin's systems, containing 10 spinning blades and five smoke bombs. When the assassin is destroyed, the launcher and its ammunition are also destroyed.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The clockwork assassin ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description: For the clockwork assassin to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. The assassin can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).A creature can attempt a [[/act disable-device dc=33]]{DC 33 Thievery} check to Disable a Device to wind the assassin down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the assassin is in standby mode.

Rapid Repair.name: Rapid Repair
Rapid Repair.description: The clockwork assassin spends 1 hour of its operational time to repair itself, regaining 25 Hit Points and refilling its integrated projectile launcher with 4 spinning blades (to a maximum of 10) and 2 smoke bombs (to a maximum of 5).

Smoke Bomb Launcher.name: Smoke Bomb Launcher
Smoke Bomb Launcher.description: The clockwork assassin launches a smoke bomb. A screen of thick, opaque smoke fills a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 60 feet of the clockwork assassin. Creatures within the area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The clockwork assassin's Strikes deal an additional 3d6+4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
Unbalancing Blow.description: Creatures hit by the clockwork assassin's rapier hand Strike are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the clockwork assassin's next turn.

Precise Tremorsense 40 feet.name: Precise Tremorsense 40 feet
Precise Tremorsense 40 feet.description:
The cobbleswarm's tremorsense is a precise sense out to 40 feet and an imprecise sense out to 80 feet. The cobbleswarm can't sense anything beyond the range of its tremorsense.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Tremorsense]

Grasping Bites.name: Grasping Bites
Grasping Bites.description:
The cobbleswarm attempts an @Check[athletics] check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of all creatures in its space.

Critical Success The creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the cobbleswarm until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

Success The creature falls prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the cobbleswarm until the creature until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

Pummeling Assault.name: Pummeling Assault
Pummeling Assault.description: Each enemy in the cobbleswarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).

Odorless.name: Odorless
Odorless.description: A myrucarx emits no smell and can't be detected by scent.

Painful Light.name: Painful Light
Painful Light.description: When attempting a save against a light effect, a myrucarx gets a result one degree of success lower than it rolled. A myrucarx caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

Illusory Persona.name: Illusory Persona
Illusory Persona.description: The illusion created by the myrucarx's project image can resemble any Medium humanoid, including any specific individual it has seen, and has appropriate voice, scent, and mannerisms, allowing the myrucarx to use its Deception check to Impersonate that humanoid if it chooses.

Twisting Reach.name: Twisting Reach
Twisting Reach.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The fanged mouths at the ends of a myrucarx's tendrils twist around obstacles. The myrucarx makes two jaws Strikes against the same target, ignoring the target's cover. Both attacks count toward the myrucarx's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are made. The myrucarx can't Grab as its next action after Twisting Reach.

Mr. Snips.name: Mr. Snips
Mr. Snips.publicNotes: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don't rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren't destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by acid (@Damage[(6d10+4)[untyped]], @Damage[(2d8+4)[untyped]] from areas and persistent damage); healed by fire (area @Damage[(2d8+4)[healing]] HP); slowed by electricity

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison.name: Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison
Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison.description: Casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} on the golem deactivates its Breath Weapon for 1 minute.

Vulnerable to Rust.name: Vulnerable to Rust
Vulnerable to Rust.description: Magical rusting effects, like a rust monster's antennae, affect the iron golem normally.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
The iron golem exhales poisonous gas in a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10-foot radius} centered on the corner of one of the iron golem's squares.

The gas persists for 1 round. Any creature in the area (or that later enters the area) is exposed to the iron golem's poison.

The golem can't use its Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Dismember.name: Dismember
Dismember.description:
Whenever Mr. Snips rolls a critical hit with a scissors Strike, in addition to dealing extra damage, the golem has a chance to dismember its victim. The target must roll a @Check[reflex|dc:39|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Success No additional effect.

Failure The target takes @Damage[2d10[bleed]].

Critical Failure As failure, and one of the targets extremities is severed (the effects of this are up to the GM's discretion).

Inexorable March.name: Inexorable March
Inexorable March.description: The iron golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it is damaged as if hit by the golem's fist.

Iron Golem Poison.name: Iron Golem Poison
Iron Golem Poison.description:
Any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} value from this poison is reduced by 1 every hour.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:35]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 round)

equipment-Blade of the Rabbit Prince.name: Blade of the Rabbit Prince
equipment-Blade of the Rabbit Prince.description:
This +2 greater striking dancing shortsword has a golden handguard resembling a bird with outstretched wings. The sword's blade is broken halfway up its length, but this doesn't impair the sword's function.

Activate 1 command, Interact

Effect You attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} an opponent using Thievery instead of Athletics, and you add the blade of the Rabbit Prince's item bonus to the check. You do not need to have a hand free if you're wielding the blade of the Rabbit Prince, and your target can be up to two sizes larger than you.

Craft Requirements You must craft the blade in the Harrowed Realm.

equipment-Hardened Harrow Deck.name: Hardened Harrow Deck
equipment-Hardened Harrow Deck.description:
The harrow is a traditional fortunetelling deck used by Varisian soothsayers. The hardened harrow deck is a magical version of the deck with cards made of thin metallic plates adorned with all the imagery common in standard harrow decks, but with more angular designs. You can hurl cards from the hardened harrow deck as +2 greater striking darts with the deadly d10 trait. A card used as a weapon isn't destroyed and can be recovered with 1 minute of searching if it can't be recalled back to the deck (see the deck's Activate entry below). However, if even a single card is missing from the deck, the deck can't be used to perform a traditional harrow reading.

As long as you carry more than half the cards in the hardened harrow deck, when you roll a success on a saving throw against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead; if you already have an ability that would make a successful saving throw against a fear effect a critical success, you instead gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against fear effects.

Activate 1 command, Interact

Effect All cards from the hardened harrow deck within 60 feet that you can see fly back into the deck.

Halfling Luck.name: Halfling Luck
Halfling Luck.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The Rabbit Prince fails a skill check or a saving throw

Effect The Rabbit Prince rerolls the triggering check, but he must use the new result, even if it's worse.

Perfect Will.name: Perfect Will
Perfect Will.description: If the Rabbit Prince rolls a success on a Will save, he gets a critical success instead, and if he rolls a critical failure, he gets a failure instead.

Superior Senses.name: Superior Senses
Superior Senses.description: The Rabbit Prince automatically critically succeeds at Seek actions to find hidden or undetected creatures within 30 feet and at flat checks to target creatures within 30 feet that are concealed or hidden from him.

Bloody Jab.name: Bloody Jab
Bloody Jab.description: Whenever the Rabbit Prince deals piercing damage, he also deals 2d10 persistent bleed damage.

Darting Flurry.name: Darting Flurry
Darting Flurry.description: The Rabbit Prince Strides and makes a blade of the Rabbit Prince Strike and a harrow card Strike at any point during the Stride. His multiple attack penalty increases only after both attacks.

Quick Movements.name: Quick Movements
Quick Movements.description: The Rabbit Prince doesn't trigger reactions with his movement or with any use of the Thievery skill.

equipment-+1 Striking Shortsword.name: +1 Striking Shortsword
equipment-+1 Striking Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

Split.name: Split
Split.description: When a child of venom is hit by an attack that would deal slashing or piercing damage and the child of venom has at least 20 HP, the creature splits into two identical children of venom with half the original's HP. One child of venom is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, they automatically push creatures and objects out of the way to fill a space.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The child of venom deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Suction.name: Suction
Suction.description: The child of venom can climb on ceilings and other inverted surfaces, though such surfaces are difficult terrain for them.

Partial Amphibian.name: Partial Amphibian
Partial Amphibian.description: The bregdi can breathe air for up to 10 minutes, or up to an hour so long as its skin remains wet.

Capsize.name: Capsize
Capsize.description: The bregdi tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. It must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 35 (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the bregdi) or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

Tug.name: Tug
Tug.description:
The bregdi pulls a creature it can reach or a creature holding something it can reach (such as a fishing line in the water).

The bregdi attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, it pulls the creature into an adjacent space. On a critical success, the bregdi can also make a jaws Strike against the creature pulled into an adjacent space.

Exorcism.name: Exorcism
Exorcism.description:
Mental damage ignores a siege shard's hardness.

Additionally, proving the siege shard's generative conflict is over with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Ma93dpT4K7JbP9gu]{Prove Peace} activity reverts the creature to ordinary stone.

Surreptitious Siege.name: Surreptitious Siege
Surreptitious Siege.description: While a siege shard is embedded within a structure while using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vh1RpbWfqdNC4L3P]{One with Stone}, the structure and all objects within it take twice as long to repair.

Overwhelming Anguish.name: Overwhelming Anguish
Overwhelming Anguish.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The siege shard emits a disorienting psychic blast. All creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:15] take @Damage[4d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:20|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
When a siege shard is destroyed within 100 feet of a structure, it reforms after [[/br 2d4 #days]] days within the nearest structure, fully healed.

A siege shard within a structure can permanently destroyed by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.QW2gYIKce3W31xXf]{Prove Peace} activity.

Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: A giant bone skipper identifies bones and creatures with a skeletal system in the listed range.

Leaping Charge.name: Leaping Charge
Leaping Charge.description: The giant bone skipper @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} up to 20 feet. It then makes a mandibles Strike, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

Marrow Rot.name: Marrow Rot
Marrow Rot.description:
Marrow rot affects only creatures with a skeletal system

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25|traits:disease]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Bullyrag Beatdown.name: Bullyrag Beatdown
Bullyrag Beatdown.description: Whenever the gang tough makes a successful melee Strike against a frightened creature, the Strike deals an extra weapon die of damage.

Frightening Critical.name: Frightening Critical
Frightening Critical.description: When the gang tough's Strike with a bludgeoning weapon is a critical hit and deals damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: The Diobel Sweeper tough Interacts to draw a bomb, then Strikes with it.

equipment-Composite Shortbow.name: Composite Shortbow
equipment-Composite Shortbow.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

equipment-Sap.name: Sap
equipment-Sap.description: A sap has a soft wrapping around a dense core, typically a leather sheath around a lead rod. Its head is wider than its grip to disperse the force of a blow, as the weapon's purpose is to knock out its victim rather than to draw blood.

equipment-+1 Striking Temple Sword.name: +1 Striking Temple Sword
equipment-+1 Striking Temple Sword.description: This heavy blade is favored by guardians of religious sites. It has a distinctive, crescent-shaped blade that seems to be a mix of a sickle and sword. It often has holes drilled into the blade or the pommel so that bells or other holy trinkets can be affixed to the weapon as an aid for prayer or mediation.

Steel Shield.name: Steel Shield
Steel Shield.description:
Like wooden shields, steel shields come in a variety of shapes and sizes. Though more expensive than wooden shields, they are much more durable.

Hardness HP BT
5 20 10

equipment-Chain Mail.name: Chain Mail
equipment-Chain Mail.description: A suit of chain mail consists of several pieces of armor composed of small metal rings linked together in a protective mesh. It typically includes a chain shirt, leggings, a pair of arms, and a coif, collectively protecting most of the body.

equipment-Arrows.name: Arrows
equipment-Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Wary.name: Wary
Wary.description: The veteran isn't off-guard to hidden creatures and always gains a +4 circumstance bonus to their Perception DC against creatures attempting to Create a Diversion or Lie to the veteran.

Power Attack.name: Power Attack
Power Attack.description: The veteran makes a melee Strike that counts as two attacks when calculating their multiple attack penalty. If this strike hits, it deals an extra die of weapon damage.

Swipe.name: Swipe
Swipe.description: The veteran makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within their melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the veteran's multiple attack penalty.

Arcane Feedback Trap.name: Arcane Feedback Trap
Arcane Feedback Trap.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:33|name:Quell Rippling Stone] (master) to quell the rippling stone or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th rank, counteract DC 31) to dispel the magical feedback.
Arcane Feedback Trap.hazarddescription: A spike of stone bursts from the south wall and quickly retracts.

Stone Spike.name: Stone Spike
Stone Spike.description:
Trigger A creature in area E1 casts an arcane spell or uses an arcane ability

Effect The trap makes a stone spike attack against the triggering creature. For the next 1 minute thereafter, the ripples are stronger, giving the trap a +2 circumstance bonus on stone spike Strikes during this time.

Dart Barrage.name: Dart Barrage
Dart Barrage.hp: (BT 30) to destroy the seal and disable the trap
Dart Barrage.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:22|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to disable the pressure plate, or four @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Plug Dart Launcher|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) checks to plug the dart launchers
Dart Barrage.hazarddescription: Four dart-loaded pipes hidden in the diagonal walls are connected to a pressure plate under the brass seal in the room's center.
Dart Barrage.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action for each disabled launcher. On each of the trap's actions, it fires one dart at a creature in the center of the room.
Dart Barrage.reset: The trap runs out of darts after 4 rounds of firing and must be reset manually by dismantling the walls to reload the launchers. If at any point there are no longer more than two creatures placing weight on the floor, the trap ceases firing but remains armed, ready to resume firing its remaining darts once triggered again.
Dart Barrage.stealthdetails: (trained) or @Check[perception|dc:23|traits:action:seek] (trained) to notice scratches around the musical pipes and a slight give to the seal

Dart Volley.name: Dart Volley
Dart Volley.description:
Trigger More than two Small or larger creatures step on the brass seal.

Effect The trap makes up to four dart Strikes against creatures standing on the seal, then rolls initiative.

No MAP.name: No MAP
No MAP.description: Darts are unaffected by Multiple Attack Penalty

equipment-+1 Striking Club.name: +1 Striking Club
equipment-+1 Striking Club.description: This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

equipment-Dagger.name: Dagger
equipment-Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment-+1 Leather Armor.name: +1 Leather Armor
equipment-+1 Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Brutish Shove.name: Brutish Shove
Brutish Shove.description:
Throwing your weight behind your attack, you hit your opponent hard enough to make it stumble back. Make a Strike with a two-handed melee weapon. If you hit a target that is your size or smaller, that creature is off-guard until the end of your current turn, and you can automatically Shove it, with the same benefits as the Shove action (including the critical success effect, if your Strike was a critical hit). If you move to follow the target, your movement doesn't trigger reactions. This Strike has the following failure effect.

Failure The target becomes off-guard until the end of your current turn.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The goon deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Thunk 'n' Slice.name: Thunk 'n' Slice
Thunk 'n' Slice.description: The Bloody Barber goon makes one dagger Strike and one club Strike, ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after the second Strike. Each Strike deals an additional 1d8 slashing or piercing damage (for the dagger) or bludgeoning damage (for the club).

Wire Catch.name: Wire Catch
Wire Catch.description:
Every Skinsaw seamer keeps a sewing needle attached to a loop of thick silk, wrapped loosely around their hand not holding a weapon, which they can use in combat to snag or disarm attackers

Trigger A creature hits the seamer with a melee Strike

Effect The seamer attempts an Athletics check to either [[/act grapple]] or [[/act disarm]] the triggering creature.

Flay.name: Flay
Flay.description:
Requirements The Skinsaw seamer dealt damage with a melee weapon other than its war razor with their last action

Effect The seamer makes a war razor Strike against the same creature that they just damaged. On a hit, the seamer slices a strip of flesh from the target and deals @Damage[1d6[bleed]] in addition to the war razor's usual damage.

Quick Stitch.name: Quick Stitch
Quick Stitch.description:
Requirements The Skinsaw seamer is currently grappling a creature

Effect The seamer stitches a piece of cloth to the creature's arm, face, or leg, potentially hindering it. The creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:26|traits:damaging-effect] saving throw; if the seamer has already successfully used their Flay ability against the creature within the past minute, the creature's save result is one degree of success worse.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (seamer's choice). This effect lasts until the creature spends a single action to tear out the stitching, which deals @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage to it.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, or off-guard (seamer's choice). This effect lasts until the creature spends 2 actions to tear out the stitching, which deals @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage to it.

Eschew Materials.name: Eschew Materials
Eschew Materials.description:
You can use clever workarounds to replicate the arcane essence of certain materials. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} that requires material components, you can provide these material components without a spell component pouch by drawing intricate replacement sigils in the air.

Unlike when providing somatic components, you still must have a hand completely free. This doesn't remove the need for any materials listed in the spell's cost entry.

Corpse Wallow.name: Corpse Wallow
Corpse Wallow.description: The ofalth zombie gains fast healing 2 as long as it is in the Catacombs or another area with a high concentration of dead.

Rotting Aura.name: Rotting Aura
Rotting Aura.description:
10 feet. The zombie emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour. Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the Ofalth Zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes @Damage[2d6[untyped]] damage as its wounds fester.

Creatures that take a critical hit from the Ofalth Zombie also take this damage immediately.

Note: This ability lists a DC 24 in the source, but the glossary ability lacks a save to make.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: The ofalth zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Bury in Offal.name: Bury in Offal
Bury in Offal.description:
The ofalth zombie makes a fling offal Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of any foes within the area of a @Template[cone|distance:15] emanating from the ofalth zombie. This counts as two attacks for the ofalth zombie's multiple attack penalty.

The ofalth zombie can't use Bury in Offal again until it moves at least 10 feet to a different space.

Wretched Weeps.name: Wretched Weeps
Wretched Weeps.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d8[bleed]] every hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d8[bleed]] every hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Avsheros the Betrayer.name: Avsheros the Betrayer
Avsheros the Betrayer.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Hateful Gaze.name: Hateful Gaze
Hateful Gaze.description:
60 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:45] save. If the creature fails, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

Avsheros can deactivate or activate this aura using a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

No matter the result of the save, a creature can't be affected by Avsheros's hateful gaze again for 1 minute.

Blasphemous Arms.name: Blasphemous Arms
Blasphemous Arms.description: Any weapon gains the effects of an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gmMrJREf4JSHd2dZ]{Unholy} property rune while Avsheros wields it.

Wail of the Betrayed.name: Wail of the Betrayed
Wail of the Betrayed.description:
Avsheros lets out an agonized wail that invokes grief and a feeling of betrayal in those who hear it.

All creatures within 120 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:47] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. A creature frightened in this way can't willingly accept aid of any kind from an ally until the frightened condition is removed.

On a successful save, the creature is immune to Avsheros's Wail of the Betrayed for 24 hours.

Shared Diversion.name: Shared Diversion
Shared Diversion.description:
Trigger Another creature in the najra lizard's square succeeds at a Deception check to Create a Diversion

Effect The najra lizard automatically successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Creates a Diversion} against the same targets.

Najra Lizard Venom.name: Najra Lizard Venom
Najra Lizard Venom.description:
The creature is extremely thirsty and can't quench its thirst while poisoned

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21|traits:poison]

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}, and [[/r {1d4}]]{1d4 damage} that can't be recovered until the creature quenches its thirst (1 round)

Stage 2 as stage 1 (1 hour)

Najra Swarm Attack.name: Najra Swarm Attack
Najra Swarm Attack.description: The najra lizard's melee Strikes deal 1d6 precision damage to creatures sharing a square with more than one najra lizard.

Dreadsong Dancer.name: Dreadsong Dancer
Dreadsong Dancer.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. composition spells

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Composition S.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Composition Spells

Jealous Musician.name: Jealous Musician
Jealous Musician.description:
Trigger A creature plays an instrument while Casting a Spell or casts a composition spell within 20 feet of the dreadsong dancer

Effect The dreadsong dancer Strides up to 20 feet and makes a songblade Strike against the triggering creature. If the Strike hits, the spell is disrupted.

Performance Anxiety.name: Performance Anxiety
Performance Anxiety.description:
A dreadsong dancer is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} if they see or hear a creature critically succeed at a Performance check or at a saving throw against their Dreadsong.

The dreadsong dancer is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} for 1 round if they see or hear a creature critically fail at a Performance check or a saving throw against their Dreadsong.

They can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.

Dreadsong.name: Dreadsong
Dreadsong.description:
The dreadsong dancer whirls their howling songblades and cloaks themself in illusion magic. Each non-fiend creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] from the dreadsong dancer must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save.

Critical Success No effect, and the creature is temporarily immune for 24 hours. The dreadsong dancer is affected by their performance anxiety.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, and the dreadsong dancer is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by the creature for 1 minute. The creature can't use Seek to find the dreadsong dancer.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature can't reduce its frightened condition below 2 for 1 minute. In addition, the dreadsong dancer is affected by its performance anxiety.

Obscuring Grab.name: Obscuring Grab
Obscuring Grab.description: While the tenome is Grabbing a creature, all other creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to the tenome.

Bone Drink.name: Bone Drink
Bone Drink.description:
Requirement The tenome has a creature grabbed or restrained

Effect The tenome makes a jaws Strike against the grabbed or restrained creature. If the Strike hits, the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or the value of the creature's drained condition increases by 1 if it already has a drained value, to a maximum of drained 4).

The tenome regains @Damage[1d8[healing]] Hit Points each time it uses Bone Drink.

Burst of Speed.name: Burst of Speed
Burst of Speed.description:
The tenome Strides twice, Steps twice, or Steps and Strides (in either order).

It cannot use Burst of Speed again for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Terrifying Gaze.name: Terrifying Gaze
Terrifying Gaze.description:
1 or 2 actions

A tenome can gaze at a creature within 30 feet by presenting one of its eyes. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. If the tenome uses 2 actions and presents both of its eyes, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} if it fails the save.

A creature that successfully saves is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Supersonic Hearing.name: Supersonic Hearing
Supersonic Hearing.description: Mobana has spent years in close proximity to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.k9BYXA4b7Z4Hy6lZ]{Deafening Music Box} in her possession and is immune to its effects. She also gains a +2 circumstance bonus against sonic effects and effects that impose the deafened condition

Swift Sneak.name: Swift Sneak
Swift Sneak.description: Mobana can move her full speed when @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneaking}.

Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
Deny Advantage.description: Mobana isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 8th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger Mobana is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see.

Effect Mobana gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
Poison Weapon.description:
Requirements Mobana is wielding a piercing or slashing weapon and has a free hand.

Effect Mobana applies a poison to the weapon.

Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
Quick Draw.description: Mobana Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Mobana deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the assassin.
